  2792                                  
  2793                                  ;************************************************************************
  2794                                  ;*									*
  2795                                  ;*	EnsureA20On - ensure that a20 is enabled if we're running	*
  2796                                  ;*	  in the HMA before interrupt entry points into Bios_Code	*
  2797                                  ;*									*
  2798                                  ;************************************************************************
  2799                                  
  2800                                  EnsureA20On:	; proc near		
  2801 000007B9 E80E00                  		call	IsA20Off
  2802                                  		;jz	short EnableA20
  2803                                  		;retn
  2804                                  		; 18/12/2022
  2805 000007BC 750B                    		jnz	short A20On_retn	
  2806                                  
  2807                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2808                                  
  2809                                  
  2810                                  EnableA20:	; proc near		
  2811 000007BE 50                      		push	ax
  2812 000007BF 53                      		push	bx
  2813 000007C0 B405                    		mov	ah, 5	 ; local enable a20
  2814                                  		;call	cs:xms
  2815 000007C2 2EFF1E[0E00]            		call	far [cs:xms] ; 16/10/2022
  2816 000007C7 5B                      		pop	bx
  2817 000007C8 58                      		pop	ax
  2818                                  A20On_retn:	; 18/12/2022	
  2819 000007C9 C3                      		retn
  2820                                  
  2821                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2822                                  
  2823                                  
  2824                                  IsA20Off:	; proc near		
  2825 000007CA 1E                      		push	ds
  2826 000007CB 06                      		push	es
  2827 000007CC 51                      		push	cx
  2828 000007CD 56                      		push	si
  2829 000007CE 57                      		push	di
  2830 000007CF 2EC536[B107]            		lds	si, [cs:HiMem]
  2831 000007D4 2EC43E[B507]            		les	di, [cs:LoMem]
  2832 000007D9 B90800                  		mov	cx, 8
  2833 000007DC F3A7                    		repe cmpsw
  2834 000007DE 5F                      		pop	di
  2835 000007DF 5E                      		pop	si
  2836 000007E0 59                      		pop	cx
  2837 000007E1 07                      		pop	es
  2838 000007E2 1F                      		pop	ds
  2839 000007E3 C3                      		retn
  2840                                  
  2841                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2842                                  
  2843                                  DisableA20:
  2844 000007E4 50                      		push	ax
  2845 000007E5 53                      		push	bx
  2846 000007E6 B406                    		mov	ah, 6		; local disable A20
  2847 000007E8 2EFF1E[0E00]            		call	far [cs:xms]
  2848                                  		;call	cs:xms
  2849 000007ED 5B                      		pop	bx
  2850 000007EE 58                      		pop	ax
  2851 000007EF C3                      		retn
  2852                                  
  2853                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2854                                  
  2855                                  ;************************************************************************
  2856                                  ;*									*
  2857                                  ;*	int19 - bootstrap interrupt -- we must restore a bunch of the	*
  2858                                  ;*	  interrupt vectors before resuming the original int19 code	*
  2859                                  ;*									*
  2860                                  ;************************************************************************
  2861                                  
  2862                                  int19:					
  2863 000007F0 0E                      		push	cs
  2864 000007F1 1F                      		pop	ds
  2865 000007F2 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; 16/10/2022
  2866 000007F6 B90500                  		mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  2867                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors
  2868 000007F9 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors	; 19/10/2022
  2869                                  next_int:				
  2870 000007FC AC                      		lodsb			; get int number
  2871 000007FD 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2872 000007FE D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  2873 00000800 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int *	4
  2874 00000802 89C7                    		mov	di, ax
  2875 00000804 AD                      		lodsw
  2876 00000805 AB                      		stosw
  2877 00000806 AD                      		lodsw
  2878 00000807 AB                      		stosw			; install the saved vector
  2879 00000808 E2F2                    		loop	next_int
  2880 0000080A 803E[3706]00            		cmp	byte [int19sem], 0 ; 19/10/2022
  2881 0000080F 7422                    		jz	short doint19
  2882 00000811 BE[3806]                		mov	si, i19_lst	; stacks code has changed these hardware interrupt vectors
  2883                                  					; stkinit in sysinit1 will initialize int19oldxx values
  2884 00000814 B90E00                  		mov	cx, 14		; num_i19
  2885                                  
  2886                                  i19_restore_loop:			
  2887 00000817 AC                      		lodsb			; get interrupt	number
  2888 00000818 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2889 00000819 89C7                    		mov	di, ax
  2890 0000081B AD                      		lodsw			; get original vector offset
  2891 0000081C 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; save it
  2892 0000081E AD                      		lodsw
  2893 0000081F 83FBFF                  		cmp	bx, 0FFFFh	; check	for 0ffffh (unlikely segment)
  2894 00000822 740D                    		jz	short i19_restor_1 ; opt no need to check selector too
  2895 00000824 83F8FF                  		cmp	ax, 0FFFFh	; opt 0ffffh is	unlikely offset
  2896 00000827 7408                    		jz	short i19_restor_1
  2897 00000829 01FF                    		add	di, di
  2898 0000082B 01FF                    		add	di, di
  2899 0000082D 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  2900 0000082E AB                      		stosw
  2901 0000082F 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  2902 00000830 AB                      		stosw			; put the vector back
  2903                                  
  2904                                  i19_restor_1:				
  2905 00000831 E2E4                    		loop	i19_restore_loop
  2906                                  
  2907                                  doint19:				
  2908 00000833 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; ; Is dos running from	HMA
  2909 00000838 7403                    		jz	short SkipVDisk
  2910 0000083A E83000                  		call	EraseVDiskHead	; Then erase our VDISK header at 1MB boundary
  2911                                  					; Some m/c's (AST 386 & HP QS/16 do not clear
  2912                                  					; the memory above 1MB during a	warm boot.
  2913                                  SkipVDisk:				
  2914 0000083D CD19                    		int	19h		; DISK BOOT
  2915                                  					; causes reboot	of disk	system
  2916                                  
  2917                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2918                                  
  2919                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2920                                  ;
  2921                                  ; procedure : int15
  2922                                  ;
  2923                                  ;		Int15 handler for recognizing ctrl-alt-del seq
  2924                                  ;		If it recognizes ctrl-alt-del and if DOS was
  2925                                  ;		is running high, it Erases the VDISK header
  2926                                  ;		present at 1MB boundary
  2927                                  ;
  2928                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2929                                  
  2930                                  ; 16/10/2022
  2931                                  ;DELKEY		equ	53h
  2932                                  ;ROMDATASEG	equ	40h
  2933                                  KBFLAG		equ	17h
  2934                                  ;CTRLSTATE	equ	04h
  2935                                  ;ALTSTATE	equ	08h
  2936                                  
  2937                                  Int15:		; proc near		
  2938                                  		;cmp	ax, 4F00h+DELKEY
  2939 0000083F 3D534F                  		cmp	ax, 4F53h	; del keystroke ?
  2940 00000842 7405                    		jz	short int15_1
  2941 00000844 2EFF2E[0B01]            		jmp	far [cs:Old15]	; 16/10/2022
  2942                                  		;jmp	cs:Old15
  2943                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2944                                  
  2945                                  int15_1:				
  2946 00000849 1E                      		push	ds
  2947 0000084A 50                      		push	ax
  2948 0000084B B84000                  		mov	ax, 40h		; ROMDATASEG
  2949 0000084E 8ED8                    		mov	ds, ax
  2950                                  		;mov	al, ds:17h	; [KBFLAG]
  2951                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2952 00000850 A01700                  		mov	al, [KBFLAG]
  2953 00000853 240C                    		and	al, 0Ch		; (CTRLSTATE | ALTSTATE)
  2954 00000855 3C0C                    		cmp	al, 0Ch		; (CTRLSTATE | ALTSTATE)
  2955 00000857 750C                    		jnz	short int15_2
  2956 00000859 0E                      		push	cs
  2957 0000085A 1F                      		pop	ds
  2958 0000085B 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; is DOS running from HMA
  2959 00000860 7403                    		jz	short int15_2
  2960 00000862 E80800                  		call	EraseVDiskHead
  2961                                  int15_2:				
  2962 00000865 58                      		pop	ax
  2963 00000866 1F                      		pop	ds
  2964 00000867 F9                      		stc
  2965 00000868 2EFF2E[0B01]            		jmp	far [cs:Old15]	; 16/10/2022
  2966                                  		;jmp	cs:Old15
  2967                                  
  2968                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2969                                  
  2970                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2971                                  ;
  2972                                  ; procedure : EraseVDiskHead
  2973                                  ;
  2974                                  ;		Erases the VDisk Header present in the 1MB boundary
  2975                                  ;
  2976                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2977                                  
  2978                                  EraseVDiskHead:	; proc near		
  2979 0000086D 50                      		push	ax
  2980 0000086E 51                      		push	cx
  2981 0000086F 57                      		push	di
  2982 00000870 06                      		push	es
  2983 00000871 E845FF                  		call	EnsureA20On
  2984 00000874 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; HMA seg
  2985 00000877 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  2986 00000879 BF1000                  		mov	di, 10h		; point	to VDISK header
  2987 0000087C B91000                  		mov	cx, 10h		; size of vdisk	header
  2988 0000087F 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  2989 00000881 F3AB                    		rep stosw		; clear	it
  2990 00000883 07                      		pop	es
  2991 00000884 5F                      		pop	di
  2992 00000885 59                      		pop	cx
  2993 00000886 58                      		pop	ax
  2994 00000887 C3                      		retn
  2995

  3002                                  ;*	  notice that we'll assume we're being entered from DOS, so	*

  3039                                  ;SR; WIN386 support
  3040                                  
  3041                                  ; WIN386 instance data structure
  3042                                  ;
  3043                                  ; Here is a Win386 startup info structure which we set up and to which
  3044                                  ; we return a pointer when Win386 initializes.
  3045                                  
  3046 00000891 0300                    Win386_SI:	db 3, 0			; SI_Version
  3047                                  					; Startup Info for Win386
  3048 00000893 00000000                SI_Next:	dd 0			; pointer to next info structure
  3049 00000897 00000000                		dd 0			; a field we don't need
  3050 0000089B 00000000                		dd 0			; another field	we don't need
  3051 0000089F [A308]                  SI_Instance:	dw Instance_Table
  3052 000008A1 7000                    		dw 70h	; Bios_Data	; far pointer to instance table
  3053                                  
  3054                                  ; This table gives Win386 the instance data in the BIOS and ROM-BIOS data
  3055                                  ; areas. Note that the address and size of the hardware stacks must
  3056                                  ; be calculated and inserted at boot time.
  3057                                  
  3058 000008A3 00005000                Instance_Table:	dw 0, 50h		; print	screen status...
  3059 000008A7 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2	bytes
  3060 000008A9 0E005000                		dw 0Eh,	50h		; ROM Basic data...
  3061 000008AD 1400                    		dw 14h			; ... 14H bytes
  3062 000008AF [0C00]                  		dw altah		; a con	device buffer...
  3063 000008B1 7000                    		dw 70h			; Bios_Data segment
  3064 000008B3 0100                    		dw 1			; ... 1 byte
  3065                                  
  3066                                  NextStack:
  3067                                  
  3068                                  ; NOTE:  If stacks are disabled by STACKS=0,0, the following
  3069                                  ;	instance items WILL NOT be filled in by SYSINIT.
  3070                                  ;	That's just fine as long as these are the last items
  3071                                  ;	in the instance list since the first item is initialized
  3072                                  ;	to 0000 at load time.
  3073                                  
  3074 000008B5 00000000                		dw 0, 0			; pointer to next stack	to be used...
  3075 000008B9 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2 bytes
  3076 000008BB 00000000                IT_StackLoc:	dd 0			; location of hardware stacks
  3077 000008BF 0000                    IT_StackSize:	dw 0			; size of hardware stacks
  3078 000008C1 00000000                		dd 0			; terminate the	instance table
  3079                                  
  3080                                  					;SR;
  3081 000008C5 00                      IsWin386:	db 0			; Flag to indicate whether
  3082                                  					; Win386 is running or not
  3083                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3084                                  
  3085                                  ;This routine was originally in BIOS_CODE but this causes a lot of problems
  3086                                  ;when we call it including checking of A20. The code being only about 
  3087                                  ;30 bytes, we might as well put it in BIOS_DATA
  3088                                  
  3089                                  V86_Crit_SetFocus:			
  3090 000008C6 57                      		push	di
  3091 000008C7 06                      		push	es
  3092 000008C8 53                      		push	bx
  3093 000008C9 50                      		push	ax
  3094 000008CA 31FF                    		xor	di, di
  3095 000008CC 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
  3096 000008CE BB1500                  		mov	bx, 15h		; Device ID of DOSMGR device
  3097 000008D1 B88416                  		mov	ax, 1684h	; Get API entry	point
  3098 000008D4 CD2F                    		int	2Fh		; - Multiplex -	MS WINDOWS - GET DEVICE	API ENTRY POINT
  3099                                  					; BX = virtual device (VxD) ID,	ES:DI =	0000h:0000h
  3100                                  					; Return: ES:DI	-> VxD API entry point,	or 0:0 if the VxD does not support an API
  3101 000008D6 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  3102 000008D8 09F8                    		or	ax, di
  3103 000008DA 740A                    		jz	short Skip	; Here,	es:di is address of API	routine.
  3104                                  					; Set up stack frame to	simulate a call.
  3105 000008DC 0E                      		push	cs
  3106                                  		;;mov	ax,offset Skip
  3107                                  		;mov	ax,Skip
  3108                                  		;push	ax
  3109                                  		; 08/10/2023
  3110 000008DD 68[E608]                		push	Skip
  3111 000008E0 06                      		push	es
  3112 000008E1 57                      		push	di		; API far call address
  3113 000008E2 B80100                  		mov	ax,1		; SetFocus function number
  3114 000008E5 CB                      		retf			; do the call
  3115                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3116                                  
  3117                                  Skip:					
  3118 000008E6 58                      		pop	ax
  3119 000008E7 5B                      		pop	bx
  3120 000008E8 07                      		pop	es
  3121 000008E9 5F                      		pop	di
  3122 000008EA CB                      		retf
  3123                                  
  3124                                  ;End WIN386 support
