  7926                                  ;
  7927                                  ; dmax_check --- call this when we want to install a new drive.
  7928                                  ;		it checks for drvmax < 26 to see if there is
  7929                                  ;		a drive letter left.
  7930                                  ;
  7931                                  ;	drvmax < 26 : carry SET!
  7932                                  ;	drvmax >=26 : carry RESET!, error flag set for message later
  7933                                  ;			trash ax
  7934                                  
  7935                                  dmax_check:	
  7936 000021E2 803E[7500]1A            		cmp	byte [drvmax], 26 ; checks for drvmax < 26
  7937 000021E7 720D                    		jb	short dmax_ok	; return with carry if okay
  7938 000021E9 06                      		push	es
  7939                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; SYSINIT_SEG (SYSINIT segment)
  7940 000021EA B84504                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 17/10/2022	
  7941 000021ED 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  7942                                  		; 18/10/2022
  7943 000021EF 26C606[FF03]01          		mov	byte [es:TOOMANYDRIVESFLAG], 1 ; 09/12/2022 
  7944                                  		;mov	byte ptr es:3FFh, 1 ; [es:toomanydrivesflag]
  7945                                  					; set message flag
  7946                                  					; [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag]
  7947 000021F5 07                      		pop	es
  7948                                  
  7949                                  		;;push	es
  7950                                  		;;mov	ax,SYSINIT_SEG
  7951                                  		;;mov	es,ax
  7952                                  		;;mov	byte [es:toomanydrivesflag],1
  7953                                  					; set message flag
  7954                                  		;;pop	es
  7955                                  		;
  7956                                  		;mov	byte [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag],1
  7957                                  dmax_ok:				
  7958 000021F6 C3                      		retn
  7959                                  
  7960                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7961                                  
  7962                                  ; 18/10/2022
  7963                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7964                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0						
  7965                                  ;								 
  7966                                  ;	link next bds (at ds:di) into the chain. assume that the
  7967                                  ;	  chain is entirely within ds == datagrp. also update drvmax,
  7968                                  ;	  dskdrv_table, and end_of_bdss.	
  7969                                  
  7970                                  xinstall_bds:		
  7971 000021F7 56                      		push	si
  7972 000021F8 53                      		push	bx
  7973 000021F9 8B36[1901]              		mov	si, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  7974                                  xinstall_bds_1:				
  7975 000021FD 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; is this the last one?
  7976 00002200 7404                    		jz	short xinstall_bds_2 ;	skip ahead if so
  7977                                  		;mov	si, [si+BDS.link]
  7978 00002202 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; chain	through	list
  7979 00002204 EBF7                    		jmp	short xinstall_bds_1
  7980                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7981                                  
  7982                                  xinstall_bds_2:				
  7983                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link], di
  7984 00002206 893C                    		mov	[si], di
  7985                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link+2], ds
  7986 00002208 8C5C02                  		mov	[si+2], ds
  7987                                  		;mov	word [di+BDS.link], -1
  7988 0000220B C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; make sure it is a null ptr.
  7989                                  		;mov	[di+BDS.link+2], ds
  7990 0000220F 8C5D02                  		mov	[di+2], ds ; might as well plug segment
  7991                                  		; 20/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7992                                  		;lea	bx, [di+BDS.BPB]
  7993 00002212 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  7994 00002215 8B36[4617]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  7995 00002219 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  7996 0000221B 8306[4617]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  7997 00002220 FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  7998 00002224 8306[4817]64            		add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  7999 00002229 5B                      		pop	bx
  8000 0000222A 5E                      		pop	si
  8001 0000222B C3                      		retn
  8002                                  
  8003                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8004                                  
  8005                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8006                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8007                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8008                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

  8011                                  cmos_clock_read:	
  8012 0000222C 50                      		push	ax
  8013 0000222D 51                      		push	cx
  8014 0000222E 52                      		push	dx
  8015 0000222F 55                      		push	bp
  8016 00002230 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  8017                                  loop_clock:
  8018 00002232 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  8019 00002234 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8020 00002236 B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  8021 00002238 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8022                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  8023                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  8024                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  8025 0000223A 83F900                  		cmp	cx, 0
  8026 0000223D 7512                    		jnz	short clock_present
  8027 0000223F 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  8028 00002242 750D                    		jnz	short clock_present
  8029 00002244 83FD01                  		cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  8030 00002247 741B                    		jz	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  8031 00002249 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  8032 0000224A B90040                  		mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  8033                                  delay:
  8034 0000224D E2FE                    		loop	delay
  8035 0000224F EBE1                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  8036                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8037                                  
  8038                                  clock_present:
  8039                                  		;mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  8040                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8041                                  		; ds = cs
  8042 00002251 C606[EC04]01            		mov	byte [havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  8043                                  		
  8044 00002256 E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  8045                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  8046                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  8047 00002259 56                      		push	si
  8048 0000225A E8C2F2                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  8049 0000225D FA                      		cli
  8050                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  8051 0000225E 8936[E904]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  8052 00002262 FB                      		sti
  8053 00002263 5E                      		pop	si
  8054                                  no_readdate:
  8055 00002264 5D                      		pop	bp
  8056 00002265 5A                      		pop	dx
  8057 00002266 59                      		pop	cx
  8058 00002267 58                      		pop	ax
  8059                                  cmosck9:	; 19/12/2023
  8060 00002268 C3                      		retn
  8061                                  
  8062                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8063                                  
  8064                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  8065                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  8066                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  8067                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  8068                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  8069                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  8070                                  ;
  8071                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  8072                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  8073                                  ;
  8074                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  8075                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  8076                                  ;
  8077                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  8078                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  8079                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initialization routine
  8080                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  8081                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  8082                                  ;
  8083                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  8084                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  8085                                  
  8086                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits
  8087                                  
  8088                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  8089                                  
  8090                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  8091                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  8092                                  
  8093                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8094                                  		; ds = cs
  8095                                  		;push	ax ; not necessary ; 19/12/2023
  8096                                  		;
  8097 00002269 803E[3506]FC            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FCh
  8098                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  8099 0000226E 75F8                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  8100 00002270 2E803E[3606]06          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  8101                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  8102                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  8103 00002276 7407                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS periodic rate if 06
  8104 00002278 803E[3606]04            		cmp	byte [secondary_model_byte], 4
  8105                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  8106                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  8107 0000227D 73E9                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST
  8108                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0
  8109                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  8110                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE
  8111                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06
  8112                                  cmosck4:
  8113 0000227F B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  8114                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  8115 00002281 B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  8116                                  					; Set divider & rate selection
  8117 00002283 E80B00                  		call	cmos_write
  8118 00002286 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  8119                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  8120 00002288 E82000                  		call	cmos_read
  8121 0000228B 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  8122                                  					; clear SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  8123 0000228D 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  8124 0000228F B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  8125                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  8126                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8127                                  		;call	cmos_write
  8128                                  ;cmosck9:
  8129                                  		;pop	ax ; 19/12/2023
  8130                                  		;retn
  8131                                  
  8132                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8133                                  		;jmp	short cmos_write
  8134                                  
  8135                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8136                                  
  8137                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  8138                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  8139                                  ;									       :
  8140                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  8141                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  8142                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  8143                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  8144                                  ;									       :
  8145                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  8146                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  8147                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  8148                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  8149                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  8150                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  8151                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8152                                  
  8153                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)
  8154 00002291 9C                      		pushf			;
  8155 00002292 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  8156 00002293 FA                      		cli
  8157 00002294 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  8158 00002295 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  8159 00002297 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  8160                                  					; RTC Seconds
  8161 00002299 90                      		nop
  8162 0000229A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  8163 0000229C E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  8164 0000229E 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  8165 0000229F 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  8166 000022A1 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  8167 000022A3 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  8168                                  					; RTC Seconds
  8169 000022A5 90                      		nop
  8170 000022A6 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  8171 000022A8 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  8172                                  
  8173                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8174                                  		;push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  8175                                  		;call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  8176                                  		;retn
  8177 000022A9 EB18                    		jmp	short cmos_rw_popf
  8178                                  
  8179                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8180                                  
  8181                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  8182                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  8183                                  ;									       :
  8184                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  8185                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  8186                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  8187                                  ;									       :
  8188                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  8189                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled. during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  8190                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  8191                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  8192                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  8193                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  8194                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8195                                  
  8196                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)
  8197 000022AB 9C                      		pushf
  8198 000022AC FA                      		cli
  8199 000022AD 53                      		push	bx
  8200                                  		;push	ax ; *		; AL = cmos table address to be read
  8201                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8202 000022AE 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax ; * ; input
  8203 000022B0 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  8204 000022B2 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  8205                                  					; RTC Seconds
  8206 000022B4 90                      		nop			; (undocumented delay needed)
  8207 000022B5 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  8208                                  		
  8209                                  		;mov	bx, ax ; output
  8210                                  		;pop	ax ; * ; input
  8211                                  
  8212                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8213                                  		; al = output, bl = input
  8214 000022B7 93                      		xchg	ax, bx ; *
  8215                                  		; bl = output, al = input
  8216                                  	
  8217 000022B8 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  8218 000022BA 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  8219 000022BC E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  8220                                  					; RTC Seconds
  8221 000022BE 90                      		nop
  8222 000022BF E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  8223                                  		;mov	ax, bx ; * ; output
  8224                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8225 000022C1 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  8226 000022C2 5B                      		pop	bx
  8227                                  
  8228                                  		; 19/12/2023
  8229                                  cmos_rw_popf:
  8230 000022C3 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  8231 000022C4 E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  8232 000022C7 C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
  8233                                  
  8234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8235                                  
  8236                                  cmos_popf:				
  8237 000022C8 CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
  8238                                  					; return far and restore flags
  8239                                  
  8240                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8241                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  8242                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8243                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
  8244                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8245                                  
  8246                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8247                                  ;
  8248                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
  8249                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
  8250                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
  8251                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
  8252                                  
  8253                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8254                                  
  8255                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
  8256                                  ;
  8257                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
  8258                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
  8259                                  ;  es:di = load location
  8260                                  
  8261                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8262                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8263                                  ; 09/12/2022
  8264                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
  8265                                  
  8266                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8267                                  getclus:
  8268                                  		; 13/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8269                                  		; ds = cs
  8270                                  
  8271 000022C9 51                      		push	cx
  8272 000022CA 57                      		push	di
  8273                                  		;mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
  8274 000022CB 890E[C616]              		mov	[doscnt], cx ; 13/12/2023
  8275 000022CF 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  8276 000022D1 48                      		dec	ax
  8277 000022D2 48                      		dec	ax
  8278 000022D3 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to logical sector
  8279                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
  8280                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
  8281                                  		;add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
  8282                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  8283                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8284 000022D5 0306[C216]              		add	ax, [bios_l]
  8285 000022D9 1316[C416]              		adc	dx, [bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  8286                                  unpack:
  8287 000022DD 1E                      		push	ds ; ds = cs ; 13/12/2023
  8288 000022DE 52                      		push	dx ; * ; 13/12/2023
  8289 000022DF 50                      		push	ax
  8290 000022E0 53                      		push	bx
  8291                                  		;mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
  8292 000022E1 8B36[C916]              		mov	si, [fatloc] ; 13/12/2023
  8293 000022E5 8EDE                    		mov	ds, si
  8294 000022E7 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; next cluster
  8295 000022E9 2EF606[C816]40          		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
  8296                                  					; 16 bit fat?
  8297 000022EF 752F                    		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
  8298 000022F1 D1EE                    		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si=si/2
  8299                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
  8300 000022F3 01DE                    		add	si, bx		;
  8301                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
  8302                                  		;push	dx ; 13/12/2023
  8303 000022F5 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8304                                  		; 12/12/2023
  8305                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  8306 000022F7 E86500                  		call	get_fat_sector
  8307                                  		;pop	dx ; 12/12/2023
  8308                                  
  8309 000022FA 8B07                    		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
  8310 000022FC 750C                    		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
  8311                                  		; 25/06/2023
  8312                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
  8313                                  
  8314                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8315                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
  8316 000022FE 50                      		push	ax ; **	; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
  8317                                  
  8318 000022FF 46                      		inc	si		; (next	byte)
  8319                                  
  8320                                  		;push	dx ; 13/12/2023
  8321 00002300 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8322 00002302 E85A00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  8323                                  		;pop	dx ; 13/12/2023
  8324                                  
  8325                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
  8326                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8327                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  8328                                  		;mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
  8329                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
  8330                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
  8331                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8332                                  		;mov	al, [cs:temp_cluster]
  8333 00002305 58                      		pop	ax  ; ** ; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
  8334 00002306 8A260000                		mov	ah, [0] ; high 4 bits (bits 7 to 11) of 12 bits cluster num
  8335                                  even_odd:
  8336 0000230A 5B                      		pop	bx		; restore old fat entry	value
  8337 0000230B 53                      		push	bx		; save it right	away.
  8338 0000230C D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
  8339 0000230E 7308                    		jnb	short havclus	; it was even.
  8340 00002310 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
  8341                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
  8342 00002312 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  8343 00002314 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  8344 00002316 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  8345                                  havclus:
  8346 00002318 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
  8347 0000231A 81E3FF0F                		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
  8348 0000231E EB0B                    		jmp	short unpackx
  8349                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8350                                  
  8351                                  unpack16:
  8352                                  		;push	dx	; 13/12/2023
  8353 00002320 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx ; 0
  8354 00002322 D1E6                    		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
  8355                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  8356                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8357 00002324 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  8358                                  
  8359                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8360                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  8361 00002326 E83600                  		call	get_fat_sector
  8362                                  		;pop	dx	; 13/12/2023
  8363 00002329 8B1F                    		mov	bx, [bx]	;
  8364                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
  8365                                  unpackx:
  8366 0000232B 5E                      		pop	si		; restore old bx value into si
  8367 0000232C 58                      		pop	ax		; restore logical sector (low)
  8368 0000232D 5A                      		pop	dx ; * ; 13/12/2023
  8369 0000232E 1F                      		pop	ds
  8370                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8371                                  		; (this is a fast kernel loading method by the MSDOS programmer)
  8372                                  		; ((consequtive clusters --> consequtive sectors))
  8373                                  		; ds = cs
  8374 0000232F 29DE                    		sub	si, bx
  8375 00002331 83FEFF                  		cmp	si, -1		; one apart? (consequtive?)
  8376                                  					; (current = previous+1)
  8377 00002334 7506                    		jnz	short getcl2	; no, read [doscnt] sectors 
  8378                                  		;add	[cs:doscnt], cx
  8379 00002336 010E[C616]              		add	[doscnt], cx ; 13/12/2023 ; add to read count
  8380 0000233A EBA1                    		jmp	short unpack
  8381                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8382                                  
  8383                                  getcl2:
  8384 0000233C 53                      		push	bx
  8385 0000233D 52                      		push	dx		; sector to read (high)
  8386 0000233E 50                      		push	ax		; sector to read (low)
  8387                                  
  8388                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8389                                  		; ds = cs
  8390                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  8391                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
  8392 0000233F A1[C016]                		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  8393 00002342 8B0E[C616]              		mov	cx, [doscnt]
  8394                                  
  8395 00002346 5A                      		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
  8396                                  		;pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
  8397                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8398 00002347 8F06[2405]              		pop	word [start_sec_h]
  8399                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
  8400                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8401                                  		; ds = cs
  8402                                  		;push	ds
  8403                                  		;push	cs
  8404                                  		;pop	ds
  8405                                  
  8406 0000234B 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  8407                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8408 0000234C BD[B108]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  8409                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  8410                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  8411 0000234F E807F4                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
  8412                                  		
  8413                                  		;pop	ds
  8414                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8415                                  		; ds = cs
  8416 00002352 5B                      		pop	bx
  8417 00002353 5F                      		pop	di
  8418                                  
  8419                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
  8420                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8421 00002354 A1[C616]                		mov	ax, [doscnt]
  8422 00002357 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
  8423 00002359 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
  8424 0000235B 01C7                    		add	di, ax		; update load location
  8425 0000235D 59                      		pop	cx		; restore sectors/cluster
  8426 0000235E C3                      		retn
  8427                                  
  8428                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8429                                  
  8430                                  
  8431                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
  8432                                  ;
  8433                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
  8434                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
  8435                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
  8436                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
  8437                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
  8438                                  ;
  8439                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  8440                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
  8441                                  ;      other registera saved.
  8442                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
  8443                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  8444                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  8445                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
  8446                                  
  8447                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8448                                  get_fat_sector:
  8449                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8450                                  		; ds = fat buffer segment
  8451                                  
  8452                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8453                                  		;push	ax ; (not necessary)
  8454 0000235F 51                      		push	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
  8455 00002360 57                      		push	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
  8456 00002361 56                      		push	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
  8457 00002362 06                      		push	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
  8458 00002363 1E                      		push	ds ; FAT buffer segment
  8459                                  
  8460                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8461 00002364 0E                      		push	cs
  8462 00002365 1F                      		pop	ds
  8463                                  
  8464 00002366 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  8465                                  		;;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  8466                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8467                                  		;mov	cx, [md_sectorsize] ; 512
  8468                                  		;div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
  8469                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8470                                  		;nop
  8471                                  
  8472                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8473 00002368 F736[CE16]              		div	word [md_sectorsize] ; 512
  8474                                  
  8475                                  		; ax = FAT sector (sequence/index) number
  8476                                  		; dx = cluster number offset
  8477                                  
  8478                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
  8479                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
  8480                                  
  8481                                  		; 13/12/2023 ; *
  8482                                  		;push	es ; *
  8483                                  		;push	ds ; *
  8484                                  		;push	di ; *
  8485 0000236C 50                      		push	ax
  8486                                  		;push	cs ; *
  8487                                  		;pop	ds ; *
  8488                                  
  8489                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
  8490                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8491 0000236D A1[C016]                		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id 
  8492 00002370 BD[C604]                		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  8493                                  		;;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
  8494                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
  8495 00002373 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  8496 00002374 E8E2F3                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
  8497 00002377 58                      		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
  8498 00002378 26034509                		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
  8499                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
  8500                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8501                                  		;pop	di ; *
  8502                                  		;pop	ds ; *
  8503                                  		;pop	es ; *
  8504                                  
  8505                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8506                                  		; ds = cs
  8507 0000237C 3B06[D016]              		cmp	ax, [last_fat_sec_num]
  8508                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
  8509 00002380 741C                    		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
  8510 00002382 A3[D016]                		mov	[last_fat_sec_num], ax
  8511                                  		;mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax
  8512                                  					; sector number
  8513                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
  8514                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8515 00002385 07                      		pop	es ; FAT buffer segment (DS on top of the stack)
  8516 00002386 06                      		push	es ; (put it on top of the stack again)
  8517                                  
  8518 00002387 52                      		push	dx ; cluster number offset
  8519                                  
  8520                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8521 00002388 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  8522 0000238A 890E[2405]              		mov	[start_sec_h], cx ;0 
  8523                                  		;mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
  8524                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
  8525                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
  8526 0000238E 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax
  8527                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8528 00002390 41                      		inc	cx ; cx = 1
  8529                                  		;mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
  8530                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
  8531 00002391 A1[C016]                		mov	ax, [drvfat]
  8532                                  		;push	ds
  8533                                  		;pop	es
  8534                                  
  8535 00002394 31FF                    		xor	di, di	; 0	; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
  8536                                  		
  8537                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8538                                  		;push	ds
  8539                                  		;push	cs
  8540                                  		;pop	ds
  8541                                  		
  8542 00002396 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  8543 00002397 BD[B108]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  8544                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  8545                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  8546 0000239A E8BCF3                  		call	call_bios_code
  8547                                  
  8548                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8549                                  		;pop	ds
  8550                                  		; ds = cs = biosdata segment
  8551                                  
  8552 0000239D 5A                      		pop	dx ; cluster number offset 
  8553                                  
  8554                                  gfs_split_chk:
  8555                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8556                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  8557 0000239E 8B0E[CE16]              		mov	cx, [md_sectorsize]
  8558                                  ;gfs_split_chk:
  8559 000023A2 49                      		dec	cx		; 511
  8560 000023A3 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
  8561                                  					; last byte of this sector,
  8562                                  					; then splitted	entry.
  8563 000023A5 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
  8564                                  		
  8565                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8566                                  		; bx = dx = cluster number offset in the FAT buffer
  8567 000023A7 1F                      		pop	ds ; FAT buffer segment
  8568 000023A8 07                      		pop	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
  8569 000023A9 5E                      		pop	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
  8570 000023AA 5F                      		pop	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
  8571 000023AB 59                      		pop	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
  8572                                  		;pop	ax
  8573                                  
  8574 000023AC C3                      		retn
  8575                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8576                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
  8577                                  
  8578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8579                                  
  8580                                  		; 09/12/2022
  8581                                  		;db 0
  8582                                  
  8583                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
  8584                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
  8585                                  
  8586                                  %if (numbertomod>0) & (numbertomod<16) ; 17/09/2023
  8587 000023AD 00<rep 3h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
  8588                                  %endif
  8589                                  
  8590                                  ;align 16
  8591                                  
  8592                                  ; 09/12/2022
  8593                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF	equ $ - BData_start
  8594                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
  8595                                  
  8596                                  ;--- End of DOSBIOS data segment --------------------------------------------
  8597                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  8602                                  
  8603                                  ;============================================================================
  8604                                  ; DOS BIOS (IO.SYS) CODE SEGMENT 
  8605                                  ;============================================================================
  8606                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8607                                  
  8608                                  section .BIOSCODE vstart=0  
  8609                                  
  8610                                  BCode_start:	 ; 09/12/2022
  8611                                   
  8612                                  ; 02/10/2022
  8613                                  
  8614                                  ;--- DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------------
  8615                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8616                                  ; MSBIO1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  8617                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8618                                  
  8619                                  DOSBIOSEG_2C7h:	;db 30h dup(0)		; SEGMENT 2C7h (2C70h-700h=2570h)
  8620 00000000 00<rep 30h>             		times 48 db 0		; 19/10/2022	
  8621 00000030 7000                    BiosDataWord:	dw 70h
  8622                                  
  8623                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8624                                  ;BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  8625                                  ; 09/12/2022
  8626                                  BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord
  8627                                  
  8628                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8629                                  
  8630                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) 
  8631                                  
  8632                                  ;************************************************************************
  8633                                  ;*									*
  8634                                  ;*	seg_reinit is called with ax = our new code segment value,	*
  8635                                  ;*	  trashes di, cx, es						*
  8636                                  ;*									*
  8637                                  ;*	cas -- should be made disposable!				*
  8638                                  ;*									*
  8639                                  ;************************************************************************
  8640                                  
  8641                                  _seg_reinit:
  8642 00000032 2E8E06[3000]            		mov	es, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
  8643                                  					; at 2C7h:30h or 70h:25A0h
  8644                                  		;mov	di, (offset cdev+2)
  8645 00000037 BF[D706]                		mov	di, cdev+2	; 19/10/2022
  8646 0000003A B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; (end_BC_entries - cdev)/4
  8647                                  
  8648                                  _seg_reinit_1:				
  8649 0000003D AB                      		stosw			; modify Bios_Code entry points
  8650 0000003E 47                      		inc	di
  8651 0000003F 47                      		inc	di
  8652 00000040 E2FB                    		loop	_seg_reinit_1
  8653 00000042 CB                      		retf
  8654                                  
  8655                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8656                                  
  8657                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8658                                  
  8659                                  ;************************************************************************
  8660                                  ;*									*
  8661                                  ;*	chardev_entry - main device driver dispatch routine		*
  8662                                  ;*	   called with a dummy parameter block on the stack		*
  8663                                  ;*	   dw dispatch_table, dw prn/aux numbers (optional)		*
  8664                                  ;*									*
  8665                                  ;*	will eventually take care of doing the transitions in		*
  8666                                  ;*	   out of Bios_Code						*
  8667                                  ;*									*
  8668                                  ;************************************************************************
  8669                                  
  8670                                  chardev_entry:				; 0070h:25B3h =	02C7h:0043h
  8671 00000043 56                      		push	si
  8672 00000044 50                      		push	ax
  8673 00000045 51                      		push	cx
  8674 00000046 52                      		push	dx
  8675 00000047 57                      		push	di
  8676 00000048 55                      		push	bp
  8677 00000049 1E                      		push	ds
  8678 0000004A 06                      		push	es
  8679 0000004B 53                      		push	bx
  8680 0000004C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
  8681 0000004E 8B7612                  		mov	si, [bp+18]	; get return address (dispatch table)
  8682                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
  8683                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  8684 00000051 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  8685 00000056 8B4402                  		mov	ax, [si+2]	; get the device number	if present
  8686 00000059 A2[2100]                		mov	[auxnum], al
  8687 0000005C 8826[E004]              		mov	[printdev], ah
  8688 00000060 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; point	to the device dispatch table
  8689 00000062 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; get pointer to i/o packet
  8690 00000066 268A4701                		mov	al, [es:bx+1]	; [es:bx+unit]	; al = unit code
  8691 0000006A 268A670D                		mov	ah, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+media]	; ah = media descrip
  8692 0000006E 268B4F12                		mov	cx, [es:bx+18]	; [es:bx+count]	; cx = count
  8693 00000072 268B5714                		mov	dx, [es:bx+20]	; [es:bx+start]	; dx = start sector
  8694                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8695 00000076 81FE[9104]              		cmp	si, DSKTBL
  8696                                  		;cmp	si, 4A2h	; dsktbl
  8697                                  					; at 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  8698 0000007A 7517                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  8699                                  
  8700                                  ; Special case for 32-bit start sector number:
  8701                                  ;   if (si==dsktbl) /* if this is a disk device call */
  8702                                  ;      set high 16 bits of secnum to 0
  8703                                  ;      if (secnum == 0xffff) fetch 32 bit sector number
  8704                                  ;
  8705                                  ; pass high word of sector number in start_sec_h, low word in dx
  8706                                  ;
  8707                                  ; note: start_l and start_h are the offsets within the io_request packet
  8708                                  ;	  which contain the low and hi words of the 32 bit start sector if
  8709                                  ;	  it has been used.
  8710                                  ;
  8711                                  ; note: remember not to destroy the registers which have been set up before
  8712                                  
  8713                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	0 ; initialize to 0
  8714 0000007C C706[2405]0000          		mov	word [start_sec_h], 0
  8715 00000082 83FAFF                  		cmp	dx, 0FFFFh
  8716 00000085 750C                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  8717 00000087 268B571C                		mov	dx, [es:bx+28]	; [es:bx+start_h]
  8718                                  					; 32 bits dsk req
  8719                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	dx ; start_sec_h = packet.start_h
  8720 0000008B 8916[2405]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx
  8721 0000008F 268B571A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+26]	; [es:bx+start_l]
  8722                                  					; dx = packet.start_l
  8723                                  no_sector32_mapping:			
  8724 00000093 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  8725 00000094 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+cmd]
  8726 00000098 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, cs:[si]
  8727 0000009B 732C                    		jnb	short command_error
  8728 0000009D 98                      		cbw			; note that al <= 15 means ok
  8729 0000009E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  8730 000000A0 01C6                    		add	si, ax
  8731 000000A2 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  8732 000000A3 26C47F0E                		les	di, [es:bx+14]	; [es:bx+trans]
  8733 000000A7 FC                      		cld
  8734                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8735 000000A8 2EFF5401                		call	near [cs:si+1]
  8736                                  		;call	word ptr cs:si+1
  8737 000000AC 7202                    		jb	short already_got_ah_status
  8738 000000AE B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8739                                  already_got_ah_status:
  8740                                  		;;mov	ds, [cs:0030h]	; 15/10/2022			
  8741                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  8742                                  					; cas note: shouldn't be needed!
  8743 000000B0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  8744                                  		;lds	bx, ds:ptrsav
  8745 000000B5 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
  8746 000000B9 894703                  		mov	[bx+3],	ax	; [bx+status]
  8747                                  					; mark operation complete
  8748 000000BC 5B                      		pop	bx
  8749 000000BD 07                      		pop	es
  8750 000000BE 1F                      		pop	ds
  8751 000000BF 5D                      		pop	bp
  8752 000000C0 5F                      		pop	di
  8753 000000C1 5A                      		pop	dx
  8754 000000C2 59                      		pop	cx
  8755 000000C3 58                      		pop	ax
  8756 000000C4 5E                      		pop	si
  8757 000000C5 83C402                  		add	sp, 2		; get rid of fake return address
  8758                                  	
  8759                                  		; fall through into bc_retf
  8760                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------	
  8761                                  bc_retf:
  8762 000000C8 CB                      		retf
  8763                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8764                                  
  8765                                  command_error:				
  8766 000000C9 E80900                  		call	bc_cmderr
  8767 000000CC EBE2                    		jmp	short already_got_ah_status
  8768                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8769                                  ; 01/05/2019
  8770                                  
  8771                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8772                                  ; The following piece of hack is for supporting CP/M compatibility
  8773                                  ; Basically at offset 5 we have a far call into 0:c0. But this does not call
  8774                                  ; 0:c0 directly instead it call f01d:fef0, because it needs to support 'lhld 6'
  8775                                  ; The following hack has to reside at ffff:d0 (= f01d:fef0) if BIOS is loaded
  8776                                  ; high.
  8777                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8778                                  
  8779                                  		;db 7 dup(0)
  8780                                  
  8781                                  		; 15/10/2022
  8782                                  
  8783 000000CE 0000                    		dw 0		; pad to bring offset to 0D0h
  8784                                  
  8785 000000D0 00<rep 5h>              off_d0: 	times 5 db 0	; 5 bytes from 0:c0 will be copied onto here
  8786                                  				;  which is the CP/M call 5 entry point
  8787                                  		
  8788                                  
  8789                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8790                                  
  8791                                  ;	exit - all routines return through this path
  8792                                  
  8793                                  bc_cmderr:				
  8794 000000D5 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  8795                                  					; unknown command error
  8796                                  
  8797                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8798                                  
  8799                                  ;	now zero the count field by subtracting its current value,
  8800                                  ;	  which is still in cx, from itself.
  8801                                  
  8802                                  ;	subtract the number of i/o's NOT YET COMPLETED from total
  8803                                  ;	  in order to return the number actually complete
  8804                                  
  8805                                  bc_err_cnt:	
  8806                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
  8807                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8808 000000D7 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8809 000000DB 26294F12                		sub	[es:bx+18], cx	; [es:bx+count]
  8810                                  					; # of successful i/o's
  8811 000000DF B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; mark error return
  8812 000000E1 F9                      		stc			; indicate abnormal end
  8813 000000E2 C3                      		retn
  8814                                  
  8815                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8816                                  
  8817                                  ;Bios_Code ends
  8818
