 14260                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14261                                  
 14262                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14263                                  
 14264                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14265                                  ;
 14266                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14267                                  ;
 14268                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14269                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14270                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14271                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14272                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14273                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14274                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14275                                  ;
 14276                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14277                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14278                                  ;
 14279                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14280                                  
 14281                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14282                                  HMAPtr:
 14283 0000136F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14284                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14285 00001374 8B3E[EB08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14286                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14287 00001378 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14288 0000137B 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14289 0000137D 803E[F108]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14290                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14291 00001382 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14292 00001384 FF1E[ED08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14293                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14294 00001388 8B3E[EB08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14295                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14296                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14297 0000138C C3                      		retn
 14298                                  
 14299                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14300                                  
 14301                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14302                                  
 14303                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14304                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14305                                  
 14306                                  move_sector:
 14307                                  
 14308                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14309                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14310                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14311                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14312                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14313                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14314                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14315                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14316                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14317                                  ;
 14318                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14319                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14320                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14321                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14322                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14323                                  
 14324 0000138D FC                      		cld
 14325 0000138E 51                      		push	cx
 14326 0000138F B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14327 00001392 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14328 00001396 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14329 00001398 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14330 0000139C 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14331 0000139E F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14332 000013A0 59                      		pop	cx
 14333 000013A1 C3                      		retn
 14334                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14335                                  
 14336                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14337 000013A2 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14338 000013A4 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14339 000013A6 59                      		pop	cx
 14340 000013A7 C3                      		retn
 14341                                  
 14342                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14343                                  
 14344                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14345                                  
 14346                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14347                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14348                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14349                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14350                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14351                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14352                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14353                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14354                                  ;
 14355                                  ; input conditions:
 14356                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14357                                  ;
 14358                                  ; output:
 14359                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14360                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14361                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14362                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14363                                  
 14364                                  check_wrap:	
 14365 000013A8 50                      		push	ax
 14366 000013A9 53                      		push	bx
 14367 000013AA 06                      		push	es
 14368 000013AB 57                      		push	di
 14369 000013AC E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14370 000013AF 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14371                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14372 000013B1 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14373                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14374 000013B6 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14375 000013B8 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14376 000013BC 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14377 000013BE 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14378 000013C1 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14379 000013C3 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14380 000013C5 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14381                                  
 14382                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14383                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14384                                  
 14385 000013C7 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14386 000013C9 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14387                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14388 000013CB 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14389 000013CC 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14390                                  					; if on	boundary
 14391                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14392                                  not_on_bound:				
 14393 000013CE 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14394 000013D1 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14395 000013D3 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14396 000013D5 40                      		inc	ax
 14397 000013D6 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14398 000013D8 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14399                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14400 000013DB 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14401 000013DF 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14402                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14403                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14404 000013E1 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14405 000013E3 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14406 000013E4 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14407                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14408 000013E6 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14409                                  
 14410                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14411                                  
 14412 000013E8 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14413 000013EA 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14414 000013EC 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14415                                  
 14416                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14417                                  
 14418 000013EE 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14419 000013F0 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14420 000013F2 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14421                                  no_head_bound:				
 14422 000013F3 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14423 000013F5 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14424 000013F6 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14425 000013F8 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14426 000013FA 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14427 000013FC 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14428 000013FF B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14429 00001401 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14430 00001403 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14431 00001405 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14432 00001407 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14433 00001409 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14434 0000140B 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14435 0000140D 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14436                                  no_wrap:				
 14437 0000140F F8                      		clc
 14438 00001410 5F                      		pop	di
 14439 00001411 07                      		pop	es
 14440 00001412 5B                      		pop	bx
 14441 00001413 58                      		pop	ax
 14442 00001414 C3                      		retn
 14443                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14444                                  
 14445                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14446 00001415 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14447 00001417 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14448 00001419 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14449                                  
 14450                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14451                                  
 14452                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14453                                  
 14454                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14455                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14456                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14457                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14458                                  ;
 14459                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14460                                  
 14461                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14462                                  find_bds:	
 14463 0000141B C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14464                                  fbds_1:					
 14465 0000141F 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14466 00001423 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14467 00001425 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14468                                  					; go to next bds
 14469 00001428 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14470 0000142B 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14471 0000142D F9                      		stc
 14472                                  fdbs_2:					
 14473 0000142E C3                      		retn
 14474                                  
 14475                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14476                                  
 14477                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14478                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14479                                  doint:
 14480                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14481 0000142F 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14482                                  					; get physical drive number
 14483                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14484                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14485                                  		
 14486 00001432 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14487 00001434 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14488 00001436 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14489                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14490 00001438 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14491                                  					; get request code
 14492                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14493 0000143B FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14494                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14495 0000143E 9D                      		popf
 14496                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14497                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14498 0000143F 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14499                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14500                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14501 00001444 9C                      		pushf
 14502                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14503 00001445 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14504                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14505                                  dointdone:				
 14506 00001448 C3                      		retn
 14507                                  
 14508                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14509                                  
 14510                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14511                                  
 14512                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14513                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14514                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14515                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14516                                  ;
 14517                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14518                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14519                                  ;
 14520                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14521                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14522                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14523                                  
 14524                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14525                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14526                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14527                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14528                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14529                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14530                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14531                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14532                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14533                                  ;end struc
 14534                                  
 14535                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14536                                  
 14537                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14538                                  ;	ah = function
 14539                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14540                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14541                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14542                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14543                                  ;   output conditions:
 14544                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14545                                  
 14546                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14547                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14548                                  ;
 14549                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14550                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14551                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14552                                  
 14553                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14554                                  
 14555                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14556                                  
 14557 00001449 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14558                                  
 14559                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14560                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14561                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14562                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14563                                  
 14564                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14565                                  
 14566                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14567                                  
 14568                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14569                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14570                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14571                                  
 14572                                  format_special_stuff:
 14573 0000144D 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 14574 00001452 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14575 00001454 53                      		push	bx
 14576 00001455 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14577 00001458 E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14578 0000145B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14579 0000145C EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14580                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14581                                  
 14582                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14583                                  
 14584                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14585                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14586                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14587                                  
 14588                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14589                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 14590 0000145E 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14591 00001460 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14592 00001462 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14593 00001463 51                      		push	cx
 14594 00001464 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14595 00001466 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14596 00001468 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14597 0000146A 8406[2805]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14598 0000146E 59                      		pop	cx
 14599 0000146F 58                      		pop	ax
 14600 00001470 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14601                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14602 00001472 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14603 00001473 06                      		push	es
 14604                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14605 00001474 2EC41E[4914]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14606                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14607                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14608 00001479 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14609 0000147B 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14610 0000147E 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14611                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14612                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14613 00001482 07                      		pop	es
 14614 00001483 5B                      		pop	bx
 14615 00001484 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14616                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14617                                  
 14618                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14619                                  
 14620                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14621                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14622                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14623                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14624                                  
 14625                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 14626 00001486 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14627                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14628 0000148B 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14629 0000148D 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14630                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14631 00001492 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14632                                  ps2_30_problem:
 14633 00001494 50                      		push	ax
 14634 00001495 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14635                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14636                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14637 00001497 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14638                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14639                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14640 0000149C 58                      		pop	ax
 14641 0000149D EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14642                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14643                                  
 14644                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14645                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14646                                  
 14647                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14648                                  
 14649                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14650                                  
 14651                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14652                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14653                                  
 14654                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14655 0000149F 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14656                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14657                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14658 000014A0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14659                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14660                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14661                                  
 14662                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14663                                  
 14664 000014A5 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14665 000014A8 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14666 000014AB 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14667                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14668                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 14669 000014AD 803E[2805]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14670 000014B2 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14671                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14672                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14673                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 14674 000014B4 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14675                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14676                                  		
 14677 000014B9 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14678                                  		
 14679 000014BA 803E[3506]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14680                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14681 000014BF 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14682                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14683                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 14684 000014C1 9D                      		popf
 14685 000014C2 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14686                                  ret_from_i13:
 14687 000014C4 1F                      		pop	ds
 14688 000014C5 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14689                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14690                                  
 14691                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14692                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14693                                  ; a changeline error.
 14694                                  
 14695                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 14696 000014C8 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14697                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14698 000014CA 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14699 000014CD 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14700 000014CF 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14701 000014D1 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14702 000014D3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14703 000014D8 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14704                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14705                                  					; never	would
 14706 000014DA 53                      		push	bx
 14707 000014DB BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14708 000014DE E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14709 000014E1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14710                                  int13b:
 14711 000014E2 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14712 000014E3 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14713                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14714                                  
 14715                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14716                                  
 14717                                  goterr13:				
 14718 000014E5 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14719 000014E8 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14720                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14721 000014EA 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14722 000014ED 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14723 000014EF 803E[2F06]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14724 000014F4 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14725                                  
 14726 000014F6 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14727                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14728                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14729                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14730 000014FB 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14731                                  
 14732 000014FD 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14733                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14734                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14735 000014FF 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14736                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14737                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14738 00001504 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14739 00001507 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14740 00001509 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14741 0000150B 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14742 0000150D 53                      		push	bx
 14743 0000150E 51                      		push	cx
 14744 0000150F 52                      		push	dx
 14745 00001510 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14746                                  loop_ecc:
 14747 00001513 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14748                                  
 14749                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14750                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14751                                  ;
 14752                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14753                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14754                                  ; track.
 14755                                  ;
 14756                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14757                                  ; this request.
 14758                                  ;
 14759                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14760                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14761                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14762                                  ;
 14763 00001516 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14764                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14765                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14766 00001519 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14767                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14768 0000151E 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14769 00001520 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14770 00001523 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14771 00001525 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14772 00001528 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14773                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14774                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14775                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14776 0000152A 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14777                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14778                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14779                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14780                                  ok11_op:
 14781 0000152C FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14782 00001530 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14783 00001532 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14784                                  					; add 200h to address
 14785 00001534 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14786 00001536 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14787 00001538 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14788                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14789                                  
 14790                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14791                                  
 14792                                  ok11_exit_err:
 14793 0000153A F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14794                                  ok11_exit:
 14795 0000153B 5A                      		pop	dx
 14796 0000153C 59                      		pop	cx
 14797 0000153D 5B                      		pop	bx
 14798 0000153E EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14799                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14800                                  
 14801                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14802                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14803                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14804                                  
 14805                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 14806 00001540 06                      		push	es
 14807 00001541 53                      		push	bx
 14808 00001542 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14809 00001545 1E                      		push	ds
 14810 00001546 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14811 00001547 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14812                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14813                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14814 0000154A 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14815                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14816 0000154F 5B                      		pop	bx
 14817 00001550 07                      		pop	es
 14818 00001551 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14819 00001553 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14820 00001556 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14821                                  
 14822                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14823                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14824                                  
 14825                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 14826 00001558 56                      		push	si
 14827 00001559 57                      		push	di
 14828 0000155A 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14829 0000155C BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14830 0000155F E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14831 00001562 5F                      		pop	di
 14832 00001563 5E                      		pop	si
 14833 00001564 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14834                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14835                                  
 14836                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14837                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14838                                  
 14839                                  gotdmaerr:
 14840 00001566 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14841 00001569 FB                      		sti
 14842 0000156A 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14843 0000156D 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14844                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14845                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14846 0000156F 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14847 00001572 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14848 00001574 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14849 00001577 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14850 00001579 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14851                                  
 14852                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14853                                  
 14854                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14855                                  
 14856 0000157B 52                      		push	dx
 14857 0000157C 51                      		push	cx
 14858 0000157D 53                      		push	bx
 14859 0000157E 50                      		push	ax
 14860 0000157F 55                      		push	bp
 14861 00001580 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14862 00001582 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14863 00001584 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14864 00001586 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14865 00001588 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14866 0000158A D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14867 0000158C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14868 0000158E 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14869                                  
 14870                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14871                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14872                                  
 14873 00001592 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14874 00001594 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14875                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14876                                  
 14877                                  no_skip_first:
 14878 00001597 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14879 00001599 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14880 0000159B 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14881                                  
 14882                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14883                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14884                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14885                                  ;
 14886                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14887                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14888                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14889                                  ; in error.
 14890                                  
 14891 0000159D 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14892 0000159F 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14893                                  
 14894                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14895                                  
 14896 000015A1 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14897                                  					; set up head number
 14898 000015A4 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14899 000015A7 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14900                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14901                                  
 14902                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 14903 000015AA B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14904 000015AC F9                      		stc
 14905 000015AD E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14906                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14907                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14908                                  
 14909                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14910                                  
 14911                                  intverify:
 14912 000015B0 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14913 000015B1 53                      		push	bx
 14914 000015B2 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14915 000015B3 07                      		pop	es
 14916                                  dosimple:
 14917 000015B4 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14918                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14919                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14920                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14921 000015B7 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14922                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14923 000015BC 5B                      		pop	bx
 14924 000015BD 07                      		pop	es
 14925 000015BE E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14926                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14927                                  
 14928                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14929                                  
 14930                                  intformat:
 14931 000015C1 06                      		push	es
 14932 000015C2 53                      		push	bx
 14933 000015C3 56                      		push	si
 14934 000015C4 57                      		push	di
 14935 000015C5 1E                      		push	ds
 14936                                  
 14937                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14938                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14939                                  
 14940 000015C6 06                      		push	es
 14941 000015C7 1E                      		push	ds
 14942 000015C8 07                      		pop	es
 14943 000015C9 1F                      		pop	ds
 14944 000015CA 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14945 000015CC BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14946 000015CF E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14947 000015D2 1F                      		pop	ds
 14948 000015D3 5F                      		pop	di
 14949 000015D4 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14950 000015D5 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14951                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14952                                  
 14953                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14954                                  ; the first block.
 14955                                  ;
 14956                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14957                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14958                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14959                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14960                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14961                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14962                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14963                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14964                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14965                                  
 14966                                  doblock:
 14967                                  
 14968                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14969                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14970                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14971                                  				
 14972 000015D7 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14973                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14974 000015DA 51                      		push	cx
 14975 000015DB 06                      		push	es
 14976 000015DC 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14977                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14978 000015DD E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14979 000015E0 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14980                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14981 000015E4 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14982                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14983 000015E9 5F                      		pop	di
 14984 000015EA 07                      		pop	es
 14985 000015EB 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14986 000015ED 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14987 000015EF B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14988 000015F1 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14989                                  doblockflop:
 14990 000015F3 59                      		pop	cx
 14991                                  doblockcontinue:
 14992 000015F4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14993 000015F6 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14994 000015F8 50                      		push	ax
 14995 000015F9 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14996 000015FB EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14997                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14998                                  
 14999                                  doblocklast:
 15000 000015FD 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15001 000015FF 50                      		push	ax
 15002                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 15003 00001600 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15004 00001603 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15005 00001605 58                      		pop	ax
 15006 00001606 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15007                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15008 00001609 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15009 0000160B 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15010 0000160D 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15011 0000160F 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15012 00001611 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15013                                  					; then we are done already.
 15014 00001613 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15015                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15016 00001615 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15017 00001618 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15018                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15019                                  
 15020                                  bufferx:
 15021 0000161A 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15022                                  					; set up head number
 15023                                  buffer:
 15024 0000161D 53                      		push	bx
 15025 0000161E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15026 00001621 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15027 00001624 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15028                                  
 15029                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15030                                  
 15031 00001626 06                      		push	es
 15032 00001627 1E                      		push	ds
 15033 00001628 56                      		push	si
 15034 00001629 57                      		push	di
 15035 0000162A 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15036 0000162B 06                      		push	es
 15037 0000162C 1F                      		pop	ds
 15038 0000162D 07                      		pop	es
 15039 0000162E BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15040 00001631 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15041 00001632 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15042 00001634 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15043 00001637 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15044                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15045 00001638 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15046 00001639 5E                      		pop	si
 15047 0000163A 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15048                                  
 15049                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15050                                  
 15051 0000163B B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15052                                  					; get drive number
 15053 0000163D 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15054 00001640 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15055                                  					;
 15056                                  					; ah is	function
 15057                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15058                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15059                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15060                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15061                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15062 00001643 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15063 00001646 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15064 00001647 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15065 00001649 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15066                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15067                                  
 15068                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15069                                  
 15070                                  doread:
 15071 0000164B 06                      		push	es
 15072 0000164C 53                      		push	bx
 15073 0000164D 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15074 0000164E 07                      		pop	es
 15075 0000164F BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15076 00001652 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15077 00001654 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15078                                  					; get drive number
 15079 00001657 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15080                                  					; ah = function
 15081                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15082                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15083                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15084 0000165A E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15085 0000165D 5B                      		pop	bx
 15086 0000165E 07                      		pop	es
 15087 0000165F 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15088 00001661 56                      		push	si
 15089 00001662 57                      		push	di
 15090 00001663 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15091 00001665 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15092 00001668 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15093 0000166B 5F                      		pop	di
 15094 0000166C 5E                      		pop	si
 15095                                  
 15096                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15097                                  
 15098                                  dotail:
 15099 0000166D 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15100 0000166E 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15101 00001671 41                      		inc	cx
 15102 00001672 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15103 00001675 F8                      		clc
 15104 00001676 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15105 00001678 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15106                                  
 15107                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15108                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15109                                  
 15110 0000167A 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15111 0000167D E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15112 00001680 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15113                                  
 15114                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15115                                  
 15116                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15117                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15118                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15119                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15120                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15121                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15122                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15123                                  
 15124                                  bad13:
 15125 00001683 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15126 00001685 5D                      		pop	bp
 15127 00001686 5B                      		pop	bx
 15128 00001687 5B                      		pop	bx
 15129 00001688 59                      		pop	cx
 15130 00001689 5A                      		pop	dx
 15131 0000168A 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15132 0000168C E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15133                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15134                                  
 15135                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 15136 0000168F E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15137                                  
 15138                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15139                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15140                                  		;db 	0
 15141                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15142                                  
 15143                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15144                                  
 15145                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15146                                  
 15147                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15148                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 15149                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15150                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15151                                  
 15152                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15153                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 15154 00001692 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 15155 00001696 BF[7E06]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 15156 00001699 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 15157 0000169A 07                      		pop	es
 15158 0000169B E915EF                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 15159                                  
 15160                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15161                                  
 15162                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15163                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15164                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15165                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15166                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15167                                  
 15168                                  install_bds:		
 15169 0000169E 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15170 0000169F BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15171                                  
 15172                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15173                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15174                                  loop_next_bds:				
 15175 000016A2 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15176                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15177 000016A4 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15178 000016A8 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15179                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15180 000016AB 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15181 000016AD B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15182 000016AF 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15183                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15184 000016B3 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15185 000016B6 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15186                                  					; we don't own it
 15187 000016BB 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15188                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15189 000016BE 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15190 000016C1 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15191                                  next_bds:				
 15192                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15193 000016C5 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15194 000016C8 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15195                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15196                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15197 000016CA 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds

 15199                                  					; install bds

 15201 000016D1 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15202                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15203                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15204 000016D4 1F                      		pop	ds
 15205                                  
 15206                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 15207                                  ;
 15208                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 15209                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 15210                                  ;
 15211                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 15212                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 15213                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 15214                                  ;

 15216                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 15217                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 15218                                  
 15219 000016D5 C3                      		retn

 15228                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg

 15238                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15239 000016D6 F606[C508]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 15240                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?

 15248                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 15249                                  no_win386:				
 15250 000016E2 51                      		push	cx
 15251 000016E3 52                      		push	dx
 15252 000016E4 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 15253                                  					; get the drive	letter
 15254

 15256                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa

 15258 000016E8 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 15259 000016EA 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 15260 000016ED 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 15261 000016EF B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 15262                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 15263                                  					; Broadcast it

 15265 000016F4 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 15266 000016F5 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 15267

 15269                                  
 15270 000016F7 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 15271                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15272 000016FA 2E8816[3417]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl

 15283                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 15284                                  wrmsg_loop:

 15286                                  					; AL = character to display
 15287 00001707 2E                      		cs

 15297                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
