 16390                                  struc	SRHEAD
 16391 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 16392 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 16393 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 16394 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 16395 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 16396                                  .size:
 16397                                  endstruc
 16398                                  
 16399                                  ;Status word masks
 16400                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 16401                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 16402                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 16403                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 16404                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 16405                                  
 16406                                  ;Function codes
 16407                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 16408                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 16409                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 16410                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 16411                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 16412                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 16413                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 16414                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 16415                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 16416                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 16417                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 16418                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 16419                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 16420                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 16421                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 16422                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 16423                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 16424                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 16425                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 16426                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write

 16428                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16429                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 16430 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 16431 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 16432 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 16433 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 16434 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 16435 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 16436                                                          ; word
 16437 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 16438 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 16439 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 16440 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 16441                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 16442                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 16443                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16444                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16445                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16446                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16447                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 16448                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16449 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 16450 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 16451 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 16452 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 16453 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 16454 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 16455                                  .size:
 16456                                  endstruc

 16458                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16459                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16460                                  
 16461                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16462                                  
 16463                                  struc buffinfo
 16464 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16465 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16466 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16467                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16468                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16469 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16470                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16471                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 16472                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 16473                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 16474                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 16475                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 16476                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 16477                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 16478 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16479                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 16480 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 16481 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 16482 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 16483 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 16484 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 16485                                  .size:
 16486                                  endstruc
 16487                                  
 16488                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 16489                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 16490                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 16491                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 16492                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 16493                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 16494                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 16495                                  
 16496                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 16497                                  
 16498                                  
 16499                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 16500                                  
 16501                                  ;Flag byte masks
 16502                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 16503                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 16504                                  ;***
 16505                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 16506                                  ;***
 16507                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 16508                                  
 16509                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 16510                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 16511                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 16512                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 16513

 16518                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16519                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16520                                  
 16521                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16522                                  
 16523                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16524                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16525                                  ;
 16526                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16527                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16528                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16529                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16530                                  ;
 16531                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16532                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16533                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16534                                  
 16535                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16536                                  
 16537                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16538                                  
 16539                                  struc	DPB
 16540 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16541 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16542 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16543 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16544 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16545 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16546 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16547 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16548 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16549 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 16550                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16551 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 16552 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 16553 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 16554 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 16555 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 16556                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 16557 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 16558 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 16559 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 16560                                  .size:
 16561                                  endstruc
 16562                                  
 16563                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 16564                                  
 16565                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 16622                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 16623                                  
 16624                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 16625                                  ;
 16626                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 16627                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 16628                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 16629                                  ;
 16630                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 16631                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 16632                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 16633                                  ;
 16634                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 16635

 16915                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16916                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16917                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16918                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16919                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16920                                  									  
 16921                                  ;*******************************					  
 16922                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16923                                  ;*******************************					  
 16924                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16925                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16926                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16927                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16928                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16929                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16930                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16931                                  ;For all others:							  
 16932                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16933                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16934                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16935                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16936                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16937                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16938                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16939                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16940                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16941                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16942                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16943                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16944                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16945                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16946                                  ;									  
 16947                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16948                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16949                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16950                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16951                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16952                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16953                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16954                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16955                                  ;									  
 16956                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16957                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16958                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16959                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16960                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16961                                  ;									  
 16962                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16963                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16964                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16965                                  ;									  
 16966                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16967                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16968                                  ;									  
 16969                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16970                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16971                                  ;									  
 16972                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16973                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16974                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16975                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16976                                  ;						called. 		  
 16977                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16978                                  ;									  
 16979                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16980                                  ;									  
 16981                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16982                                  ;									  
 16983                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16984                                  ;									  
 16985                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16986                                  ;									  
 16987                                  
 16988                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16989                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16990 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16991 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16992                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16993 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16994 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16995 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16996 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16997                                  endstruc					  
 16998                                  									  
 16999                                  ;FeatureByte1	bit map equates 					  
 17000                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 17001                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 17002                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 17003                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 17004                                  					;;End of Modification

 17106                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17107                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17108                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17109                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17110                                  
 17111                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 17112                                  ;
 17113                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 17114                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 17115                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 17116                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 17117                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 17118                                  ;
 17119                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 17120                                  ;
 17121                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 17122                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 17123                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 17124                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 17125                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 17126                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 17127                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 17128                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 17129                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 17130                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 17131                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 17132                                  
 17133                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 17134                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 17135                                  
 17136                                  struc 		curdir_list
 17137                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17138 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 17139 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 17140 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 17141 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 17142 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 17143 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 17144                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 17145 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 17146 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 17147 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 17148                                  .size:
 17149                                  endstruc
 17150                                  
 17151                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 17152                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 17153                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 17154                                  						; argument
 17155                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 17156                                  
 17157                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 17158                                  
 17159                                  ;Flag word masks
 17160                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17161                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17162                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 17163                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 17164                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 17166                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17167                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17168                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17169                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17170                                  
 17171                                  ; 09/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.1 (BugFix)
 17172                                  
 17173                                  ; system file table
 17174                                  
 17175                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 17176                                  ;
 17177                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 17178                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 17179                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 17180                                  
 17181                                  struc	SF
 17182 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 17183 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 17184 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 17185                                  .size:
 17186                                  endstruc
 17187                                  
 17188                                  ;**	System file table entry
 17189                                  ;
 17190                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 17191                                  
 17192                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 17193 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 17194                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 17195 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 17196 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 17197 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 17198                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 17199                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 17200                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 17201                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 17202                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 17203                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 17204                                  					;   (WRITE)
 17205                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 17206                                  					;
 17207                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 17208                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 17209                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 17210                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 17211                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 17212                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 17213                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 17214                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 17215                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 17216                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 17217                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 17218                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 17219 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 17220                                  					; to device header if local device,
 17221                                  					; points to net device header if
 17222                                  					; remote
 17223 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 17224                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 17225 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 17226 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 17227 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 17228 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 17229                                  ;
 17230                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 17231                                  ; ID
 17232                                  ;
 17233 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 17234 0000001B ????????                .sf_dirsec:	resd	1 ; 09/04/2024	; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 17235 0000001F ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 17236                                  ;
 17237                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 17238                                  ;
 17239 00000020 <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 17240                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 17241                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 17242                                  					; disk changed errors.
 17243                                  ; SHARING INFO
 17244 0000002B ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 17245 0000002F ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 17246 00000031 ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 17247 00000033 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 17248 00000035 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 17249 00000037 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 17250                                  .size:
 17251                                  endstruc

 17530                                  ; 05/07/2018
 17531                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17532                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17533                                  
 17534                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17535                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17536                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17537                                  
 17538                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17539                                  ;
 17540                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17541                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17542                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17543                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17544                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17545                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17546                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17547                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17548                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17549                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 17550                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 17551                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 17552                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 17553                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 17554                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 17555                                  ;
 17556                                  
 17557                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 17558                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 17559                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 17560                                  ;
 17561                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 17562                                  ;
 17563                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 17564                                  ;
 17565                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 17566                                  ;
 17567                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 17568                                  ;
 17569                                  
 17570                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 17571                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 17572                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 17573                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 17574                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 17575                                  ;      deeply nested one
 17576                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 17577                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 17578                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 17579                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 17580                                  
 17581                                  		;EVEN
 17582                                  ;align 2
 17583                                  		; 21/10/2022
 17584                                  
 17585 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 17586 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 17587 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 17588 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 17589 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 17590 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 17591                                  
 17592 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 17593 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17594 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17595                                  
 17596                                  ;***********************************************************************
 17597                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 17598                                  
 17599                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17600                                  
 17601 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 17602                                  
 17603                                  int02:
 17604                                  
 17605                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17606                                  ;
 17607                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 17608                                  ;
 17609                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 17610                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 17611                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 17612                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 17613                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 17614                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 17615                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 17616                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 17617                                  ;
 17618                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 17619                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 17620                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 17621                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 17622                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 17623                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 17624                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 17625                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 17626                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 17627                                  ;
 17628                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17629                                  
 17630 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 17631 00000017 06                      	push	es
 17632 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 17633 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17634                                  	; 02/11/2022
 17635 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 17636 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 17637 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 17638                                  
 17639 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 17640                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 17641                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 17642                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 17643                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 17644 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 17645 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 17646                                  special02:
 17647 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 17648 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 17649                                  normal02:
 17650 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 17651 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17652 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 17880                                  ;********************************************************************
 17881                                  ;common routines
 17882                                  ;********************************************************************
 17883                                  
 17884                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17885                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17886                                  ; service routine
 17887                                  
 17888                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17889                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17890                                  
 17891                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17892                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17893                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17894                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17895                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17896                                  
 17897                                  do_int_stacks:
 17898 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17899 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17900 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17901 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17902 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17903 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17904                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17905                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17906                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17907 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17908 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17909 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 17910                                  
 17911 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17912                                  
 17913                                  found02:
 17914 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17915 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17916                                  
 17917 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17918                                  
 17919 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17920                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17921                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17922                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17923                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17924 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17925 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17926                                  
 17927                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17928                                  	;mov	es,bp
 17929                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 17930                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17931                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 17932                                  	;mov	sp,es
 17933                                  	;mov	es,ax
 17934                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17935                                  
 17936                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 17937 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 17938 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 17939 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17940 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 17941 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 17942 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 17943 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 17944 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 17945                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17946                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17947 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17948                                  
 17949 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17950                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17951 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17952                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17953                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17954                                  
 17955 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17956                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17957 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17958                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17959                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17960 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17961 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17962                                  
 17963                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17964                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17965                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17966 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17967 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17968                                  
 17969 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 17970 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17971 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17972 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 17973 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17974                                  
 17975                                  notfree02:
 17976 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17977 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 17978                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17979                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 17980                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17981 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17982                                  
 17983                                  findnext02:
 17984 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17985 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 17986                                  
 17987                                  foundbad02:
 17988 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17989 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17990 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17991                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17992                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17993                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17994 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17995 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17996                                  
 17997                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17998                                  
 17999                                  ; Common routines
 18000                                  
 18001                                  longpath:
 18002                                  	; 21/03/2019
 18003 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 18004                                  lploopp:
 18005                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18006                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 18007                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18008 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 18009 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 18010                                  
 18011 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 18012                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18013                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 18014                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18015 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18016 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 18017 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 18018                                  
 18019 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 18020 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 18021                                  
 18022                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18023                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 18024                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18025 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 18026                                  inuse:
 18027 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18028 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 18029 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 18030 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 18031                                  found:
 18032 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 18033                                  fatal:
 18034 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 18035 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 18036 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18037 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 18038 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 18039 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 18040                                  
 18041 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 18042 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 18043                                  
 18044                                  skip_nmis:
 18045 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 18046 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 18047 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 18048 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 18049                                  
 18050 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 18051 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 18052 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 18053                                  ;SR;
 18054                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 18055                                  ;
 18056 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 18057 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 18058                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 18059                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 18060                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18061 00000217 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 18062 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18063                                  
 18064                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 18065 0000021C F606[C508]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 18066 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 18067 00000222 58                      	pop	ax
 18068 00000223 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 18069                                  
 18070                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)

 18422                                  ; set fake_floppy_drv if there is no diskette drives in this machine.
 18423                                  ; execute the equipment determination interrupt and then

 18438                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
 18439                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one

 18441                                  ; WARNING !!!
 18442                                  ;

 18503                                  ;;	cas -- a) if we got our memory size from the ROM, we should test it
 18504                                  ;;		  before we try to run.
 18505                                  ;;	       b) in any case, we should check for sufficient memory and give
 18506                                  ;;		  an appropriate error diagnostic if there isn't enough
 18507                                  ;

 18509                                  ;	pop	ds
 18510                                  ;
 18511                                  ;;	cas note:  It would be better to put dos + bios_code BELOW sysinit
 18512                                  ;;	  that way it would be easier to slide them down home in a minimal
 18513                                  ;;	  memory system after sysinit.  As it is, you need room to keep
 18514                                  ;;	  two full non-overlapping copies, since sysinit sits between the
 18515                                  ;;	  temporary home and the final one.  the problem with doing that
 18516                                  ;;	  is that sys*.asm are filled with "mov ax,cs, sub ax,11h" type stuff.

 19251                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 19252                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 19253                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 19254                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19255                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 19256                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 19257                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 19258                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 19259                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 19260                                  ;
 19261                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 19262                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 19263                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 19264                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19265                                  ; been patched.
 19266                                  
 19267                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0

 19551 000007CE BA[5233]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 19552                                  
 19553                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 19554                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 19555                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 19556                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 19557                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 19558                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 19559                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 19560                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 19561                                  
 19562                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 19563                                  
 19564 000007D1 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 19565 000007D2 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19566 000007D5 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 19567 000007D7 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece

 19569 000007DB CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 19570 000007DD 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 19571                                  
 19572 000007DF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19573 000007E1 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 19574 000007E3 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 19575 000007E5 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 19576                                  
 19577                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 19578                                  
 19579                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 19580                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 19581                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 19582                                  
 19583                                  	; 22/10/2022
 19584                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 19586 000007EB 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 19587                                  
 19588                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 19589                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 19590                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 19591                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 19592                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 19593                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 19594                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 19595                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 19596                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 19597                                  ;
 19598                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 19599                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 19600                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 19601                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 19602                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 19603                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 19604                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 19605                                  
 19606                                  	; 22/10/2022

 19950                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi

 19953                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19954                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19955                                  ;

 19957                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19958                                  ;

 19992                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19993                                  ;
 19994                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19995                                  ;
 19996                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19997                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19998                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19999                                  ;
 20000                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 20001                                  ;
 20002                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20003                                  
 20004                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 20016                                  
 20017                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA

 20019

 20024

 20026                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20027                                  	;xor	di,di
 20028                                  	
 20029                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20030                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 20031                                  	; 11/12/2022

 20037                                  ;else

 20039                                  ;

 20319                                  ;

 20321                                  ;

 20323                                  ;
 20324                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20325                                  
 20326                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20327                                  
 20328                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 20329                                  
 20330                                  AllocMemForDOS:
 20331                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20332                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20333                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20334                                  	; ds = cs
 20335                                  	;mov	ax,BCode_end
 20336                                  	;sub	ax,BCode_start		; BIOS code size
 20337                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20338 00000944 B8A019                  	mov	ax,BCODE_END ; 1A60h

 20340                                  	; 09/12/2022

 20342                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 20345                                  	; 11/12/2022

 20350                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20353 00000954 09DB                    	or	bx,bx				; M012
 20354 00000956 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc
 20355 00000958 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 20356 0000095A B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 20357 0000095C CD21                    	int	21h
 20358 0000095E 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 20359                                   	; 23/10/2022
 20360                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 20361 00000960 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 20362                                  						;  BIOS code
 20363 00000963 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20364                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 20365                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 20366                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20367                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system

 20369                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20372                                  
 20373 00000973 C3                      	retn
 20374                                  
 20375                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20376                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20377                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20378                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20379                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20380                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20381                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20382                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20383                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20384                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20385                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20386                                  ;
 20387                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20388                                  
 20389                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20390                                  update_arena:
 20391 00000974 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20392 00000975 57                      	push	di
 20393 00000976 51                      	push	cx
 20394 00000977 52                      	push	dx
 20395                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20396                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20397                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20398                                  	; ds = cs 
 20399 00000978 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20400 0000097C 4F                      	dec	di
 20401 0000097D 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20402                                  						;  before sysvar
 20403 0000097E 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20404                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20405 00000980 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20406 00000985 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20407 00000987 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20408                                  
 20409                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20410 00000989 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20411 0000098E 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20412 00000990 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20413 00000992 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20414 00000994 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20415                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20416 00000996 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20417                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20418 0000099A C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20419 000009A0 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20420                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20421 000009A2 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20422 000009A6 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20423                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20424                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20425 000009A8 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20426 000009AB 5A                      	pop	dx
 20427 000009AC 59                      	pop	cx
 20428 000009AD 5F                      	pop	di
 20429 000009AE 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20430 000009AF C3                      	retn
 20431                                  ;
 20432                                  ; M012 : END
 20433                                  ;
 20434                                  FatalErr:
 20435 000009B0 0E                      	push	cs
 20436 000009B1 1F                      	pop	ds
 20437 000009B2 BA[7D08]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 20438 000009B5 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20439 000009B7 CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20440                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20441                                          ;jmp	stall
 20442                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20443 000009B9 FA                      	cli

 20450                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20451                                  ;
 20452                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20453                                  ;
 20454                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20455                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20456                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20457                                  ;
 20458                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20459                                  ;
 20460                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20461                                  
 20462                                  AllocHMA:
 20463                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20464                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20465                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20466                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20467                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20468                                  
 20469                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20470                                  ;
 20471                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20472                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20473                                  ;	push	ax
 20474                                  ;	popf
 20475                                  ;	pushf
 20476                                  ;	pop	ax
 20477                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20478                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20479                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20480                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20481                                  
 20482                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20483                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20484

 20486                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data

 20621                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20622                                  ;
 20623                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20624                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20625                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20626                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20627                                  ;
 20628                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20629                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20630                                  ;
 20631                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20632                                  
 20633                                  StartVDHead:
 20634                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20635                                  
 20636 00000A33 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20637 00000A37 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20638 00000A39 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20639 00000A3B 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20640 00000A3D 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20641                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20642 00000A3E 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20643                                  VDiskSig1:
 20644 00000A45 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20645                                  
 20646                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20647                                  
 20648 00000A4A 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20649                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20650 00000A50 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20651 00000A5F 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20652 00000A61 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20653                                  VDInt19:
 20654 00000A62 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20655                                  OldVDInt19:
 20656 00000A63 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20657                                  
 20658                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20659                                  
 20660                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20661 00000A67 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20662                                  VDiskSig2:
 20663 00000A6A 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20664                                  
 20665                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20666                                  
 20667 00000A6F 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20668 00000A72 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20669 00000A74 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20670 00000A75 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20671 00000A77 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20672 00000A78 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20673 00000A7A 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20674 00000A7C FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20675 00000A7D 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20676 00000A7F 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20677 00000A81 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20678 00000A83 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20679 00000A85 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20680                                  
 20681                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20684                                  ;
 20685                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20686                                  ;
 20687                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20688                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20689                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20690                                  ;
 20691                                  ; Inputs : None
 20692                                  ;
 20693                                  ; Outputs : None
 20694                                  ;
 20695                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20696                                  ;
 20697                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20698                                  
 20699                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20700                                  
 20701                                  InstVDiskHeader:

 20714

 20716

 20722

 20724

 20731 00000AB1 40                      	inc	ax
 20732 00000AB2 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
