 20823                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20824                                  
 20825                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20826                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20827                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20828                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20829                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20830                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20831                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20832                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20833                                  ;								      ;I070
 20834                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20835                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20836                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20837                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20838                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20839                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20840                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20841                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20842                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20843                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20844                                  ;								      ;I070
 20845                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20846                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20847                                  
 20848                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20849                                  	; ds = cs

 20931                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 20932                                  ;
 20933                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 20934                                  ;		& INT 19 vector

 20970                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20971                                  ;
 20972                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20973                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20974                                  ;
 20975                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20976                                  
 20977                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20978                                  CPMHack:
 20979 00000BA0 1E                      	push	ds
 20980 00000BA1 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20981 00000BA4 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20982                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20983                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20984 00000BA6 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20985 00000BA7 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20986 00000BA9 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20987 00000BAC BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20988                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20989 00000BAF B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20990 00000BB1 FC                      	cld
 20991 00000BB2 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20992 00000BB4 1F                      	pop	ds
 20993 00000BB5 C3                      	retn

 21889                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21890                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21891                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21892                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21893                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21894                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21895                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21896                                  ;
 21897                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21898                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21899                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21900                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21901                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21902                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21903                                  ;
 21904                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21905                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21906                                  ;
 21907                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21908                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21909                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21910                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21911                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21912                                  ;
 21913                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21914                                  ;
 21915                                  ;			  none.
 21916                                  
 21917                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21918                                  ;
 21919                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21920                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21921                                  
 21922                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21923

 22124                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22125                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22126                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22127                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22128                                  ;
 22129                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22130                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22131                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22132                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22133                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22134                                  ; program).
 22135                                  
 22136                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22137                                  
 22138                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22139                                  
 22140 0000101A 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22141                                  
 22142                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22143                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22144                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22145                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22146                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22147                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22148                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22149                                  ; carridge return.
 22150                                  
 22151                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22152                                  ;character after =.
 22153                                  
 22154 0000101B 06                      	push	es
 22155 0000101C 1E                      	push	ds
 22156 0000101D 07                      	pop	es
 22157 0000101E 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22158 0000101F 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22159                                  
 22160 00001021 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22161 00001023 FC                      	cld
 22162 00001024 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22163 0000102A BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 22164                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 22165 0000102D AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 22166 0000102E 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 22167 00001030 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 22168 00001032 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 22169                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 22170 00001034 AC                      	lodsb
 22171 00001035 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 22172 00001038 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 22173 0000103A 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 22174 0000103C FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 22175 0000103E 47                      	inc	di
 22176 0000103F EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 22177                                  done_installparm:
 22178 00001041 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.

 22263 0000108C B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 22264 0000108E CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 22265 00001090 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 22266 00001093 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 22267 00001095 E80316                  	call    error_line
 22268 00001098 F9                      	stc
 22269                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 22270 00001099 C3                      	retn

 22272                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22273                                  
 22274                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22275                                  ;
 22276                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22277                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22278                                  ;
 22279                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22280                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22281                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22282                                  
 22283                                  ParaRound:
 22284 0000109A 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22285 0000109D D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22286 0000109F D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22287 000010A1 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22288 000010A3 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22289 000010A5 C3                      	retn
 22290                                  
 22291                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22292                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22293                                  ;
 22294                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22295                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22296                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22297                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22298                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22299                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22300                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22301                                  ;
 22302                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22303                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22304                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22305                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22306                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22307                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22308                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22309                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22310                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22311                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22312                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22313                                  ;
 22314                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22315                                  
 22316                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22317                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22318                                  sysinit_base:				
 22319 000010A6 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22320 000010AB 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22321 000010B0 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22322 000010B2 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22323 000010B7 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22324 000010BC 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22325 000010BD 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22326 000010BE 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22327                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22328                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22329 000010C0 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22330 000010C3 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22331 000010C8 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22332                                  
 22333                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22334                                  
 22335 000010CA B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22336 000010CC 0E                      	push	cs
 22337 000010CD 1F                      	pop	ds
 22338 000010CE BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22339 000010D1 CD21                    	int	21h
 22340                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22341                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22342                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22343                                  _stall: 
 22344                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22345 000010D3 F4                      	hlt 
 22346                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22347                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22348 000010D4 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22349                                  
 22350                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22351 000010D6 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22352                                  
 22353                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22354                                  
 22355                                  sum_up:
 22356                                  
 22357                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22358                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22359                                  ;
 22360                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22361                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22362                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22363                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22364                                  ;
 22365                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22366                                  
 22367 000010DB 1E                      	push	ds
 22368                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22369                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22370 000010DC 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22371 000010E0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22372 000010E2 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22373 000010E4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22374 000010E6 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22375                                  					;whole test better fail.
 22376 000010EB D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22377 000010ED 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22378                                  sum1:
 22379 000010EF 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22380 000010F1 46                      	inc	si
 22381 000010F2 46                      	inc	si
 22382 000010F3 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22383                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22384                                  sum_sys_code:
 22385                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22386 000010F5 BEF410                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22387                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22388                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22389                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22390                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22391                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22392                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 22393                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 22394 000010F8 B9[E037]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22395 000010FB 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22396 000010FD D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22397                                  sum2:
 22398 000010FF 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22399 00001102 46                      	inc	si
 22400 00001103 46                      	inc	si
 22401 00001104 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22402 00001106 1F                      	pop	ds
 22403 00001107 C3                      	retn
 22404                                  
 22405                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22406                                  
 22407                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22408                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 22409 00001108 0000                    	dw	0
 22410                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22411                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 22412 0000110A 0000                    	dw	0

 22484 00001160 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff

 22488 00001169 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax

 22491 00001170 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22492                                  set_buff_2:

 22495 00001178 2E800E[0614]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 22501                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22502                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22503                                  ;
 22504                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem

 22507                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 22533                                  	; zf=1
 22534

 22572                                  ; ======================================================================
 22573                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22574                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22575                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22576                                  
 22577                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22578                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22579                                  ;
 22580                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22581                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22582                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22583                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22584                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22585                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22586                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22587                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22588                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22589                                  ;
 22590                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22591                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22592                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22593                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22594                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22595                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22596                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22597                                  ;	conditions:
 22598                                  ;
 22599                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22600                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22601                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22602                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22603                                  ;
 22604                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22605                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22606                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22607                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22608                                  ;
 22609                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22610                                  ;
 22611                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22612                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22613                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22614                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22615                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22616                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22617                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22618                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22619                                  ;
 22620                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22621                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22622                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22623                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22624                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22625                                  ;
 22626                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22627                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22628                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22629                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22630                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22631                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22632                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22633                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22634                                  ;
 22635                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22636                                  
 22637                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22638                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22639                                  
 22640                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22641                                  stackinit:
 22642 000011CE 50                      	push	ax
 22643 000011CF 1E                      	push	ds
 22644 000011D0 06                      	push	es
 22645 000011D1 53                      	push	bx
 22646 000011D2 51                      	push	cx
 22647 000011D3 52                      	push	dx
 22648 000011D4 57                      	push	di
 22649 000011D5 56                      	push	si
 22650 000011D6 55                      	push	bp
 22651                                  
 22652                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22653                                  
 22654                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22655                                  	; ds = cs
 22656 000011D7 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22657 000011DA 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22658                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22659                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22660                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22661 000011DC 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22662                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22663 000011E0 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22664 000011E3 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22665                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22666 000011E7 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22667                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22668                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22669                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22670 000011EA 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22671                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22672 000011EE 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22673 000011F0 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22674                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22675                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22676                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22677 000011F3 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22678                                  
 22679                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22680                                  
 22681                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22682                                  
 22683                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22684                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22685                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22686 000011F7 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22687                                  
 22688                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22689                                  
 22690 000011FC B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22691                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22692                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22693                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22694 000011FF F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22695 00001201 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22696 00001203 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22697 00001207 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22698 00001209 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22699                                  
 22700                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22701                                  
 22702 0000120C 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22703 00001211 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22704 00001215 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22705 00001217 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22706 00001219 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22707 0000121B 06                      	push	es
 22708 0000121C 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22709                                  
 22710                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22711                                  
 22712 0000121D 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22713 00001221 FC                      	cld

 22715

 23479                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23480                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23481                                  
 23482                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23483                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23484                                  
 23485                                  new_init_loop:
 23486                                  
 23487                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23488                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23489                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23490                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23491                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23492                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23493                                  
 23494 000013C0 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23495 000013C3 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23496 000013C5 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23497 000013C9 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23498                                  
 23499 000013CC 1E                      	push	ds
 23500                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23501                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23502                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23503 000013CD B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23504 000013D0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23505 000013D2 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23506 000013D5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23507 000013D7 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23508 000013DB 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23509 000013DE 1F                      	pop	ds
 23510                                  
 23511 000013DF 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23512 000013E2 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23513 000013E6 C3                      	retn
 23514                                  
 23515                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23516                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 23521                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23522                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23523                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23524                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23525                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.

 23553                                  	;pop	es

 23799                                  
 23800                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23801                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23802                                  ;
 23803                                  ;
 23804                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23805                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23806                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23807                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23808                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23809                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23810                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23811                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23812                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23813                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23814                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23815                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23816                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23817                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23818                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23819                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23820                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23821                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23822                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23823                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23824                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23825                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23826                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23827                                  ;	   :
 23828                                  ;
 23829                                  ;Note:
 23830                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23831                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23832                                  ;
 23833                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23834                                  ;
 23835                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23836                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23837                                  ;
 23838                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23839                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23840                                  ;
 23841                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23842                                  ;
 23843                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23844                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23845                                  ;
 23846                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23847                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23848                                  ;
 23849                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23850                                  ;
 23851                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23852                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23853                                  ;
 23854                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23855                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23856                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23857                                  ;
 23858                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23859                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23860                                  ;
 23861                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23862                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23863                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23864                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23865                                  
 23866                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23867                                  
 23868                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23869                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23870                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23871                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23872                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23873                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23874                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23875                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23876                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23877                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23878                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23879                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23880                                  
 23881                                  ;**** Function flags
 23882                                  
 23883                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23884                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23885                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23886                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23887                                  
 23888                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23889                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23890 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23891 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23892 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23893 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23894 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23895 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23896                                  endstruc
 23897                                  
 23898                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23899                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23900                                  ;
 23901                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23902                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23903                                  ;	     +-
 23904                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23905                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23906                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23907                                  ;	     |	:
 23908                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23909                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23910                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23911                                  ;	     |	:
 23912                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23913                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23914                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23915                                  ;	     +-	:
 23916                                  ;
 23917                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23918                                  ;
 23919                                  ;Note:
 23920                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23921                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23922                                  ;
 23923                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23924                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23925                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23926                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23927                                  
 23928                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23929                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23930                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23931                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23932                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23933                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23934                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23935                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23936                                  
 23937                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23938 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23939 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23940 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23941 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23942 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23943                                  endstruc
 23944                                  
 23945                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23946                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23947                                  ;
 23948                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23949                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23950                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23951                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23952                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23953                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23954                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23955                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23956                                  ;
 23957                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23958                                  ;
 23959                                  ;            +-
 23960                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23961                                  ;	    | or
 23962                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23963                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23964                                  ;	    | or
 23965                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23966                                  ;	    | or
 23967                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23968                                  ;	    | or
 23969                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23970                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23971                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23972                                  ;	    | or
 23973                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23974                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23975                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23976                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23977                                  ;	    +-
 23978                                  ;
 23979                                  ;
 23980                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23981                                  ;      list.
 23982                                  ;
 23983                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23984                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23985                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23986                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23987

 23990 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23991 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23992 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23993 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23994                                  endstruc

 23998                                  
 23999                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 24000                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 24001                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 24002                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 24003                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 24004                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 24005                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 24006                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 24007                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 24008                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 24009

 24015

 24017                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 24018                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 24019                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 24020                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 24021                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 24022                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 24023                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24024                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24025                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24109                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24110                                  ; SysParse;
 24111                                  ;
 24112                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24113                                  ;
 24114                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24115                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24116                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24117                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24118                                  ;
 24119                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24120                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24121                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24122                                  ;
 24123                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24124                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24125                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24126                                  ;
 24127                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24128                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24129                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24130                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24131                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24132                                  ;
 24133                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24134                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24135                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24136                                  ;
 24137                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24138                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24139                                  ;
 24140                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24141                                  ;
 24142                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24143                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24144                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24145                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24146                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24147                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24148                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24149                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24150                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24151                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24152                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24153                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24154                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24155                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24156                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24157                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24158                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24159                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24160                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24161                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24162                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24163                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24164                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24165                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24166                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24167                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24168                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24169                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24170                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24171                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24172                                  
 24173                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24174                                  
 24175                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24176                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24177                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24178                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24179                                  
 24180                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24181                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24182                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24183                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24184                                  ;
 24185                                  
 24186                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24187                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24188                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24189                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24190                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24191                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24192                                  
 24193                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24194                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24195                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24196                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24197                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24198                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24199                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24200                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24201                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.

 24806                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24807                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24808                                  ;
 24809                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24810                                  ;
 24811                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24812                                  ;	    AL = type
 24813                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24814                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24815                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24816                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24817                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24818                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24819                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24820                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24821                                  ;
 24822                                  ; Output:   None
 24823                                  ;
 24824                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24825                                  ;
 24826                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24827                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24828                                  
 24829                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 24835                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24836                                  	; 07/09/2023
 24837                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 24838 000016CD 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 24839                                  
 24840 000016D0 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 24842 000016D5 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 24843                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24844 000016D9 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24845                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 24846 000016DA 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number

 24919                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 24920                                  ;
 24921                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 24922                                  ;	     result buffer
 24923                                  ;
 24924                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 24925                                  ;		Complex
 24926                                  ;		Date
 24927                                  ;		Time
 24928                                  ;		Drive
 24929                                  ;		Filespec
 24930                                  ;		Quoted String
 24931                                  ;		Simple String
 24932                                  ;
 24933                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24934                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24935                                  ;
 24936                                  ; Output:    None
 24937                                  ;
 24938                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 24939                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 24940                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format
 24941                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24942                                  
 24943                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24944                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:19CFh)
 24945

 25222                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25223                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25224                                  ;
 25225                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25226                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25227                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25228                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25229                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25230                                  ;
 25231                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25232                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25233                                  ;
 25234                                  ; Output:    None
 25235                                  ;
 25236                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25237                                  ;
 25238                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25239                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25240                                  
 25241                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25242                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25243                                  
 25244                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25245 00001872 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25246 00001873 2E800E[1914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25247 00001879 2E8026[1914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25248 0000187F 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25249 00001882 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25250 00001884 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25251                                  
 25252 00001886 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25253 00001888 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25254                                  
 25255 0000188A 2E800E[1914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25256                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25257 00001890 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25258                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25259 00001891 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25260 00001894 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25261 00001895 C3                      	retn

 25265                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25266                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;

 25288

 25292 000018BE D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25293 000018C0 E8BA00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25294 000018C3 721F                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit

 25310                                  
 25311 000018E1 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 25312 000018E2 EBBB                    	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25313                                  ;
 25314                                  _$P_Value_Err0:				;AN000;

 25316 000018E5 E98300                  	jmp	_$P_Value_Err		;AN000; Bridge
 25317                                  ;

 25322

 26115                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26116                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26117                                  ;
 26118                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26119                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26120                                  ;	    blanks.
 26121                                  ;
 26122                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26123                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26124                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26125                                  ;
 26126                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26127                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26128                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26129                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26130                                  
 26131                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26132 00001BBD 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26133 00001BBE 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26134 00001BBF 2EC606[1314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26135                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26136                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26137 00001BC5 2E8026[1914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;

 26139 00001BCD 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26140                                  
 26141 00001BCF 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26142 00001BD1 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26143                                  
 26144 00001BD3 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?

 26146

 26148                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26149                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 14/08/2023
 26150                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26151                                  %if 0
 26152                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26153                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26154                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26155                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26156

 26159

 26162                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26163                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26168                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26169 00001BDC 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26170                                  
 26171                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26172 00001BDE 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26173                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26174 00001BE0 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26175                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list

 26177                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26178                                  	; 14/08/2023

 26212                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26213                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26214                                  ;
 26215                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26216                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26217                                  ;
 26218                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26219                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26220                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26221                                  ;
 26222                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26223                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26224                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26225                                  
 26226                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26227                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26228                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26229                                  ;
 26230                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26231                                  
 26232                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26233                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26234                                  
 26235                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26236                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26237                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26238                                  	; 14/08/2023
 26239 00001C0B BD[2214]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26240                                  
 26241                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26242 00001C0E 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26243 00001C10 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26244                                  
 26245                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26246 00001C12 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26247 00001C14 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26248                                  
 26249 00001C16 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26250                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26251                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26252 00001C17 C3                      	retn
 26253                                  
 26254                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26255                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26256                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26257                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26258                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26259                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26260                                  
 26261                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26262                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26263 00001C18 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26264 00001C1A 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26265                                  
 26266 00001C1C 2E800E[1914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26267                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26268                                  
 26269                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26270                                  	; cf=0
 26271                                  	;retn
 26272                                  
 26273                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26274                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26275                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26276 00001C22 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26277                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26278                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26279 00001C23 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26311 00001C34 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26312 00001C35 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;

 26319                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
