 26912                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26913                                  
 26914                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26915                                  
 26916                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26917                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26918                                  
 26919                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26920                                  ;
 26921                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26922                                  ;
 26923                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26924                                  ;
 26925                                  ;   Modification log:
 26926                                  ;
 26927                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26928                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26929                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26930                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26931                                  ;
 26932                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26933                                  ;
 26934                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26935                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26936                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26937                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26938                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26939                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26940                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26941                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26942                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26943                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26944                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26945                                  ;
 26946                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26947                                  
 26948                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26949                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26950                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26951                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26952                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26953                                  
 26954                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26955                                  
 26956                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26957                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26958                                  
 26959                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26960                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26961                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26962                                  
 26963                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26964                                  ;
 26965                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26966                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26967                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26968                                  ;	           line.
 26969                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26970                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26971                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26972                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26973                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26974                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26975                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26976                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26977                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26978                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26979                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26980                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26981                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26982                                  ;	           for details).
 26983                                  
 26984                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26985                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26986                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26987                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26988                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26989                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26990                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26991                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26992                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26993                                  
 26994                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26995                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26996                                  
 26997                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26998                                  
 26999                                  %endif
 27000                                  
 27001                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27002                                  
 27003                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 27004                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 27005                                  
 27006                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27007                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27008                                  
 27009                                  		;public	DevEntry
 27010                                  
 27011 00001E56 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 27012 00001E58 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27013 00001E5A 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27014 00001E5C 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27015 00001E60 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 27016                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 27017                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 27018                                  ;
 27019 00001E64 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 27020 00001E65 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 27021 00001E67 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 27022 00001E69 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 27023                                  ;
 27024 00001E6B 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 27025                                  ;
 27026 00001E6F 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 27027 00001E71 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 27028                                  ;
 27029 00001E73 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 27030                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 27031 00001E74 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 27032                                  ;
 27033 00001E76 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 27034 00001E77 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 27035 00001E79 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 27036                                  ;
 27037 00001E81 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 27038 00001E82 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 27039 00001E84 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 27040 00001E88 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 27041                                  				; to use the file name in the command line
 27042                                  ;

 27044                                  ;MagicHomeFlag:	db	0	; set non-zero when MagicDrv is final placed

 27056                                  ; procedure : doconf

 27064                                  doconf:

 27066 00001E8A 1F                      	pop	ds
 27067

 27101

 27103                                  	;mov	ax,4200h

 27105 00001EB8 CD21                    	int	21h
 27106                                  
 27107                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27108                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27109 00001EBA 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27110                                  
 27111 00001EBE A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27112 00001EC1 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27113 00001EC4 E8D3F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27114 00001EC7 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27115                                  
 27116                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27117                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27118                                  ;;
 27119                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27120                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27121                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27122                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27123                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27124                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27125                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27126                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27127                                  ;;
 27128                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27129                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27130                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27131                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27132                                  
 27133 00001EC9 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27134                                  	
 27135                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27136                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27137                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27138 00001ECC 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27139 00001ED0 E8ECEC                  	call    TempCDS 
 27140                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27141                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27142 00001ED3 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 27143                                   
 27144 00001ED8 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27145 00001EDA 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27146                                  
 27147 00001EDC 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27148 00001EDE 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27149 00001EE3 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27150                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27151 00001EE5 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27152 00001EE6 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27153 00001EE8 9C                      	pushf
 27154                                  
 27155                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27156                                  
 27157 00001EE9 50                      	push	ax
 27158 00001EEA 57                      	push	di
 27159 00001EEB 51                      	push	cx
 27160 00001EEC B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27161 00001EEE 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27162 00001EF0 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27163 00001EF2 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27164 00001EF4 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27165                                  
 27166                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27167                                  
 27168 00001EF6 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27169                                  
 27170                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27171                                  
 27172                                  puteol:
 27173 00001EF7 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27174 00001EF9 AA                      	stosb
 27175 00001EFA B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27176 00001EFC AA                      	stosb
 27177 00001EFD 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27178                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27179                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27180                                  
 27181                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27182                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27183 00001EFF 0E                      	push	cs
 27184 00001F00 1F                      	pop	ds
 27185                                  
 27186 00001F01 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27187                                  
 27188 00001F05 59                      	pop	cx
 27189 00001F06 5F                      	pop	di
 27190 00001F07 58                      	pop	ax
 27191                                  
 27192                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27193                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27194                                  	;push	cs
 27195                                  	;pop	ds
 27196                                  
 27197 00001F08 50                      	push	ax
 27198                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27199 00001F09 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27200 00001F0B CD21                    	int	21h
 27201 00001F0D 58                      	pop	ax
 27202 00001F0E 9D                      	popf
 27203 00001F0F 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 27204 00001F11 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 27205 00001F13 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27206                                  conferr:
 27207 00001F15 BA[F932]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 27208 00001F18 E83513                  	call	badfil
 27209                                  endconv:
 27210 00001F1B C3                      	retn
 27211                                  
 27212                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27213                                  ;
 27214                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 27215                                  ;
 27216                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 27217                                  ;
 27218                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27219                                  
 27220                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27221                                  multi_pass:
 27222 00001F1C 0E                      	push	cs
 27223 00001F1D 1F                      	pop	ds
 27224                                  
 27225 00001F1E 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 27226                                  ;jae_endconv:
 27227 00001F23 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 27228                                  
 27229                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 27230                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27231 00001F25 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 27232 00001F29 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 27233                                  
 27234 00001F2A 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 27235 00001F2E 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 27236 00001F32 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 27237 00001F34 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 27238 00001F38 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 27239                                  
 27240 00001F3C E89510                  	call	getchr
 27241 00001F3F EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 27242                                  
 27243                                  getcom:
 27244 00001F41 E8790E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 27245 00001F44 E88D10                  	call	getchr
 27246                                  conflp: 
 27247 00001F47 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 27248                                  
 27249 00001F49 FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 27250                                  
 27251 00001F4D C606[0314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27252 00001F52 C606[0614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 27253 00001F57 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 27254 00001F59 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 27255                                  
 27256                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27257                                  %if 0
 27258                                  
 27259                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27260                                  
 27261                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27262                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27263                                  
 27264                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27265                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27266                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27267                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27268                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27269                                  
 27270                                          push    ax                      ;
 27271                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27272                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27273                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27274                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27275                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27276                                          pop     ax
 27277                                  ;
 27278                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27279                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27280                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27281                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27282                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27283                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27284                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27285                                  ;   spot.
 27286                                  ;
 27287                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27288                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27289                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27290                                  ;   retrieved.
 27291                                  ;
 27292                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27293                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 27294                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27295                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27296                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27297                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27298                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 27299                                  final:                                  ;
 27300                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27301                                  not_final:                              ;
 27302                                  ;endif
 27303                                  
 27304                                  %endif
 27305 00001F5B 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27306 00001F5D E87410                  	call	getchr
 27307 00001F60 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27308                                  
 27309 00001F62 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 27310                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 27311                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27312 00001F67 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 27313 00001F69 E9FB06                  	jmp	badop
 27314                                  	
 27315                                  coff:	
 27316                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27317                                  	; ds = cs
 27318                                  	;push	cs
 27319                                  	;pop	ds
 27320 00001F6C E85C10                  	call	newline
 27321 00001F6F EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 27322                                  
 27323                                  blank_line:
 27324 00001F71 E86010                  	call	getchr
 27325 00001F74 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 27326                                  
 27327                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27328                                  ; 11/12/2022
 27329                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 27330                                  ;coff_p:
 27331                                  	;push	cs
 27332                                  	;pop	ds
 27333                                  
 27334                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 27335                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27336                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27337                                  ;install= command.
 27338                                  
 27339                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27340                                  ;install command
 27341                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27342                                  
 27343                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27344                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 27345                                  tryi:
 27346 00001F76 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 27347 00001F7B 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 27348 00001F7D E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 27349                                  not_init_pass:
 27350 00001F80 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 27351                                          ; 11/12/2022
 27352                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 27353 00001F85 74E5                    	je	short coff
 27354                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27355                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27356                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 27357                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 27358                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 27359                                  					; and before install= commands
 27360                                  					; are processed
 27361                                  
 27362 00001F87 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 27363 00001F8C 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 27364 00001F8E 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 27365                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27366                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 27367 00001F91 74D9                    	je	short coff
 27368                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27369                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27370                                  
 27371                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 27372                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 27373                                          
 27374 00001F93 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 27375                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 27376                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27377 00001F96 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 27378                                  	
 27379                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 27380 00001F98 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27381                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 27382 00001F9D EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 27383                                  
 27384                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27385                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 27386                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 27387                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 27388                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27389                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27390                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 27391                                  
 27392                                  multi_try_i:
 27393 00001F9F 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 27394                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 27395                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27396 00001FA2 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 27397                                  
 27398                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27399                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27400                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27401                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27402                                  ;;endif
 27403                                  
 27404 00001FA4 E873F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 27405 00001FA7 EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 27406                                  
 27407                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27408                                  %if 0
 27409                                  
 27410                                  multi_try_n:
 27411                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 27412                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 27413                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27414                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27415                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27416                                  ;endif
 27417                                  
 27418                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 27419                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 27420                                  
 27421                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 27422                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 27423                                  	mov	bx,ax
 27424                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 27425                                  
 27426                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 27427                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 27428                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 27429                                  
 27430                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 27431                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 27432                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 27433                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 27434                                  
 27435                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 27436                                  	mov	bx,1
 27437                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 27438                                  
 27439                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 27440                                  
 27441                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 27442                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 27443                                          int     21h
 27444                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 27445                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 27446                                          int     21h
 27447                                  
 27448                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 27449                                  
 27450                                  %endif
 27451                                  
 27452                                  multi_pass_filter:
 27453 00001FA9 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 27454 00001FAC 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 27455 00001FAE 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 27456 00001FB1 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 27457 00001FB3 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 27458 00001FB6 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 27459                                  
 27460                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 27461 00001FB8 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 27462 00001FBC FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 27463                                  
 27464                                  multi_pass_coff:
 27465                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27466 00001FC0 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 27467                                  
 27468                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27469                                  ; buffer command
 27470                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27471                                  
 27472                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27473                                  ;									      *
 27474                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27475                                  ;									      *
 27476                                  ; input :								      *
 27477                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27478                                  ; output:								      *
 27479                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27480                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27481                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *

 29018                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29019                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29020                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29021                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29022                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29023                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29024                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29025                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29026                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29027                                  
 29028                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29029                                  ;									  *
 29030                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29031                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29032                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29033                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29034                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29035                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29036                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29037                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29038                                  ; input :								  *
 29039                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29040                                  ; output:								  *
 29041                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29042                                  ;									  *
 29043                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29044                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29045                                  ; logic:								  *
 29046                                  ; {									  *
 29047                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29048                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29049                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29050                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29051                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29052                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29053                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29054                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29055                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29056                                  ;	     }								  *
 29057                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29058                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29059                                  ;	};								  *
 29060                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29061                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29062                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29063                                  ; };									  *
 29064                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29065

 29370                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29371                                  ; fcbs command
 29372                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29373                                  
 29374                                  ;************************************************************************
 29375                                  ; function: parse the parameters of fcbs= command.			*
 29376                                  ;									*
 29377                                  ; input :								*
 29378                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				*
 29379                                  ; output:								*
 29380                                  ;	set the variables fcbs,keep.					*
 29381                                  ;									*
 29382                                  ; subroutines to be called:						*
 29383                                  ;	sysinit_parse							*
 29384                                  ; logic:								*
 29385                                  ; {									*
 29386                                  ;	set di points to fcbs_parms;					*
 29387                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						*
 29388                                  ;	while (end of command line)					*
 29389                                  ;	{ sysparse;							*
 29390                                  ;	  if (no error) then						*
 29391                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = fcbs */		*
 29392                                  ;		   fcbs = result_val._$P_picked_val;			*
 29393                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = keep */ 	*
 29394                                  ;		   keep = result_val._$P_picked_val;			*
 29395                                  ;	     }								*
 29396                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						*
 29397                                  ;	     error exit;						*
 29398                                  ;	};								*
 29399                                  ; };									*
 29400                                  ;************************************************************************
 29401                                  
 29402                                  tryx:
 29403 0000256C 80FC58                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_FCBS  ; 'X'

 29733                                  sysinit_parse:
 29734                                  
 29735                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29736                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29737                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 29738                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29739                                  ;
 29740                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29741                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29742                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29743                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29744                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29745                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29746                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29747                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29748                                  ;	 procedure.
 29749                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29750                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29751                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29752                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 29753                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer

 30095                                  ;
 30096                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30097                                  ;
 30098                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30099                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30100                                  ;
 30101                                  ;	Output : none
 30102                                  ;
 30103                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30104                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30105                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30106                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30107                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30108                                  ;
 30109                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30112                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30113                                  	; ds = cs

 30116                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30117 000026F0 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30118 000026F3 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30119                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30120                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30121                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30122                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 30123                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30124                                  	; ds = cs
 30125 000026F5 803E[731E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30126 000026FA 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30127 000026FC A1[5A1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30128                                  lim_set:
 30129                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30130                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30131                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30132                                  ;limx:
 30133                                  	;retn
 30134                                  	
 30135                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 30136                                  
 30137                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30138                                  ;
 30139                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30140                                  ;
 30141                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30142                                  ;	Output : none
 30143                                  ;
 30144                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30145                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30146                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30147                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30148                                  ;
 30149                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30150                                  
 30151                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30152                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30153 000026FF 1E                      	push	ds
 30154 00002700 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30155 00002703 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30156 00002705 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30157 00002709 2E891E[771E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30158 0000270E B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30159 00002710 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30160 00002712 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30161 00002715 2EC606[761E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30162 0000271B 1F                      	pop	ds
 30163                                  ;limx:
 30164 0000271C C3                      	retn
 30165                                  
 30166                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30167                                  ;
 30168                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30169                                  ;
 30170                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30171                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30172                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30173                                  ;
 30174                                  ;	Output : none
 30175                                  ;
 30176                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30177                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30178                                  ;
 30179                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30180

 30182                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30183                                  	; ds = cs
 30184 0000271D 803E[761E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0

 30186                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30187                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30188 00002722 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30189                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30190 00002724 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30191 00002727 8826[761E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30192                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30193                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30194 0000272B 1E                      	push	ds
 30195                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30196 0000272C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30197 0000272E 2EA1[771E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30198 00002732 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 30199 00002735 1F                      	pop	ds
 30200                                  timx:
 30201 00002736 C3                      	retn

 30250                                  
 30251                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30252                                  
 30253                                  %if 0
 30254                                  
 30255                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30256                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30257                                  
 30258                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30259                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30260                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30261                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30262                                  
 30263                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30264                                  ;
 30265                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30266                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30267                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30268                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30269                                  ;
 30270                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30271                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30272                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30273                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30274                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30275                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30276                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30277                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30278                                  ; available during the load.
 30279                                  ;
 30280                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30281                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30282                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30283                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30284                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30285                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30286                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30287                                  ;
 30288                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30289                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30290                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30291                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30292                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30293                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30294                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30295                                  ;
 30296                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30297                                  
 30298                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30299                                  
 30300                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30301                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30302                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30303                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30304                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30305                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30306                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30307                                  
 30308                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30309                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30310                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30311                                  
 30312                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30313                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30314                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30315                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30316                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30317                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30318                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30319                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30320                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 30321                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30322                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30323                                  
 30324                                  InitVar:
 30325                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30326                                  	push	ax
 30327                                  	push	cx
 30328                                  	push	di
 30329                                  	push	es
 30330                                  
 30331                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30332                                  	push	cs
 30333                                  	pop	es
 30334                                  
 30335                                  	xor	ax,ax
 30336                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30337                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30338                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30339                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30340                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30341                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30342                                  
 30343                                  	cld
 30344                                  
 30345                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30346                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30347                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30348                                  
 30349                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30350                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30351                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30352                                  
 30353                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30354                                  
 30355                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30356                                  	pop	es
 30357                                  	pop	di
 30358                                  	pop	cx
 30359                                  	pop	ax	 	
 30360                                  
 30361                                  	retn
 30362                                  
 30363                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30364                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30365                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30366                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30367                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30368                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30369                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30370                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30371                                  
 30372                                  FixMem:
 30373                                  	push	ax
 30374                                  	push	bx
 30375                                  	push	cx
 30376                                  	push	dx
 30377                                  	push	es
 30378                                  
 30379                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30380                                  
 30381                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30382                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30383                                  
 30384                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30385                                  
 30386                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30387                                  
 30388                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30389                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30390                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30391                                  
 30392                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30393                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30394                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30395                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30396                                  
 30397                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30398                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30399                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30400                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30401                                  
 30402                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30403                                  
 30404                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30405                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30406                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30407                                  
 30408                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30409                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30410                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30411                                  	inc	bx
 30412                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30413                                  
 30414                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30415                                  
 30416                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30417                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30418                                  
 30419                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30420                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30421                                  	inc	bx
 30422                                  	mov	es,bx
 30423                                  
 30424                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30425                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30426                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30427                                  fmX:	
 30428                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30429                                  
 30430                                  	pop	es
 30431                                  	pop	dx
 30432                                  	pop	cx
 30433                                  	pop	bx
 30434                                  	pop	ax
 30435                                  
 30436                                  	retn
 30437                                  
 30438                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30439                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30440                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30441                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30442                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30443                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30444                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30445                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30446                                  
 30447                                  fm_link:
 30448                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30449                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30450                                  
 30451                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30452                                  	;
 30453                                  	;push	es
 30454                                  	;push	cs
 30455                                  	;pop	es
 30456                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30457                                  	;pop	es
 30458                                  	
 30459                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30460                                  
 30461                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30462                                  	mov	bx,1
 30463                                  	int	21h
 30464                                  	retn
 30465                                  
 30466                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30467                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30468                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30469                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30470                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30471                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30472                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30473                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30474                                  
 30475                                  fm_unlink:
 30476                                  	xor	bx,bx
 30477                                  	
 30478                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30479                                  	;
 30480                                  	;push	ds
 30481                                  	;push	cs
 30482                                  	;pop	ds
 30483                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30484                                  	;pop	ds
 30485                                  	
 30486                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30487                                  
 30488                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30489                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30490                                  	retn
 30491                                  
 30492                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30493                                  
 30494                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30495                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30496                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30497                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30498                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30499                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30500                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30501                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30502                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30503                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30504                                  ;
 30505                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30506                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30507                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30508                                  ;
 30509                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30510                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30511                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30512                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30513                                  ;
 30514                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30515                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30516                                  ;
 30517                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30518                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30519                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30520                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30521                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30522                                  ;     lh
 30523                                  ;     /l
 30524                                  ;     1
 30525                                  ;     1000
 30526                                  ;     2
 30527                                  ;     print
 30528                                  ;     /d
 30529                                  ;     :lpt2
 30530                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30531                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30532                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30533                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30534                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30535                                  ; for:
 30536                                  ;    Each /L
 30537                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30538                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30539                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30540                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30541                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30542                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30543                                  
 30544                                  ParseVar:
 30545                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30546                                  	push	di
 30547                                  	push	ds
 30548                                  	push	es
 30549                                  
 30550                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30551                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30552                                  	cld
 30553                                  
 30554                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30555                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30556                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30557                                  
 30558                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30559                                  	call	isWhite
 30560                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30561                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30562                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30563                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30564                                  
 30565                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30566                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30567                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30568                                  
 30569                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30570                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30571                                  	and	al,0DFh
 30572                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30573                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30574                                  	jne	short pv30
 30575                                  
 30576                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30577                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30578                                  
 30579                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30580                                  	;
 30581                                  	;push	es
 30582                                  	;push	cs
 30583                                  	;pop	es
 30584                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30585                                  	;pop	es
 30586                                  
 30587                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30588                                  
 30589                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30590                                  
 30591                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30592                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30593                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30594                                  
 30595                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30596                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30597                                  
 30598                                  	call	parseL
 30599                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30600                                  
 30601                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30602                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30603                                  
 30604                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30605                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30606                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 30607                                  	dec	si
 30608                                  	stc
 30609                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30610                                  	pop	es
 30611                                  	pop	ds
 30612                                  	pop	di
 30613                                  	retn
 30614                                  
 30615                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30616                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
